RegisterGroup.name: PERI_CRG0
RegisterGroup.description: PERI_CRG0 is a CPU clock gating and soft reset control register.

Member.name: freq_sel_cpu
Member.description:
CPU clock select.
00: 24 MHz XTAL clock
01: PLL clock
10: doze clock
11: PLL clock

Member.name: cpuclk_skipcfg
Member.description:
Skip configuration of the CPU clock.
N: N-beat clocks are skipped every 32-beat CPU clocks.

Member.name: cpuclk_loaden
Member.description:
Skip configuration enable for the CPU clock.
0: disabled
1: enabled
To change the skip configuration, perform the following steps:
1. Write a new skip configuration value.
2. Write 0 to loaden.
3. Write 1 to loaden.

Member.name: cpu_source_sel
Member.description:
CPU clock source select.
000: 500 MHz
001: 396 MHz
010: 300 MHz
011: reserved
100: DDR2X
1XX: DDR2X

Member.name: cs_srst_req
Member.description:
CS soft reset request.
0: deassert reset
1: reset

Member.description:

1: reset

1: reset

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_CRG12
RegisterGroup.description: PERI_CRG12 is an AO0 clock frequency divider configuration register.

Member.name: ao_ckcfg0
Member.description: Clock frequency divider of AO MCLK0. The configured value is calculated as follows: (MCLK0/Frequency of the AO0 clock source) x 2^27.

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_CRG13
RegisterGroup.description: PERI_CRG13 is an AO0 clock select configuration register.

Member.name: ao0_bclkout_pctrl
Member.description:
AO0 BCLKOUT polarity.
0: positive
1: negative

Member.name: spdif_clk_sel
Member.description:
SPDIF clock select.
0: MCLK0
1: MCLK1

Member.name: fsclk_div0
Member.description:
Frequency division relationship between the bit clock BCLK and the sampling clock FS.
000: The FS is obtained by dividing the BCLK by 16.
001: The FS is obtained by dividing the BCLK by 32.
010: The FS is obtained by dividing the BCLK by 48.
011: The FS is obtained by dividing the BCLK by 64.
100: The FS is obtained by dividing the BCLK by 128.
101: The FS is obtained by dividing the BCLK by 256.
Other values: The FS is obtained by dividing the BCLK by 8.

Member.name: bclk_div0
Member.description:
Frequency division relationship between the main clock MCLK and the bit clock BCLK.
0000: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 1.
0001: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 3.
0010: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 2.
0011: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 4.
0100: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 6.
0101: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 8.
0110: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 12.
0111: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 16.
1000: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 24.
1001: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 32.
1010: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 48.
1011: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 64.
Other values: The BCLK is obtained by dividing the MCLK by 8.

Member.name: ao0_cken
Member.description:
AO0 clock status.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: jtag_io_sel
Member.description:
Multiplexing control indicator of JTAG pins.
0: The pin function depends on pin multiplexing registers.
1: The pin function is JTAG.
Note: JTAG pins include JTAG_TDI, JTAG_TCK, JTAG_TMS, JTAG_TDO, and JTAG_TRSTN. When jtag_io_sel is 0, the pin function depends on the values of led_gpio_jtal, csn0_gpio_jtal, key_gpio_jtal, and ir_gpio_jtal. For details, see the description of section "Pin Multiplexing" in the Hi3712 HD Satellite STB Processor Hardware User Guide.

RegisterGroup.name: SC_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: SC_CTRL is a system control register. It is used to specify the operations that are performedby the system.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this field returns 0 and writing this field has no effect.

Member.name: wdogenov
Member.description:
Watchdog count clock select.
0: crystal oscillator clock
1: bus clock

Member.name: channel_powersta
Member.description:
Power-down status indicator of the channel module.
0: normal working mode
1: powered down

Member.name: remapstat
Member.description:
Address remap status.
0: remap clear
1: remap

Member.name: remapclear
Member.description:
Address remap clear.
0: not cleared
1: cleared

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this field returns 0 and writing this field has no effect.

Member.name: modestatus
Member.description:
Mode status. Reading this field returns the current system operating mode.
0000: reserved
0001: doze
0011: XTAL CTL
1011: SWtoXTAL
1001: SWfromXTAL
0010: slow
0110: PLL CTL
1110: SWtoPLL
1010: SWfromPLL
0100: normal
Other values: reserved

Member.name: modectrl
Member.description:
Mode control. This field defines the operating mode to which the system controller will switch.
000: reserved
001: doze
010: slow
100: normal
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: SC_SYSRES
RegisterGroup.description: SC_SYSRES is a system status register. When a value is written to this register, the systemcontroller sends a system soft reset request to the reset module. Then the reset module resetsthe system.

Member.name: softresreq
Member.description: The system is reset when any value is written to this register.

RegisterGroup.name: SC_XTALCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: SC_XTALCTRL is a crystal oscillator control register. It is used to control the stable timeafter the clock module is initialized. The stable time is the wait time during which the mode isswitched from XTAL CTL to SWtoXTAL.

Member.name: xtaltime
Member.description:
Wait time for switching the crystal oscillator clock.
This field specifies the wait time during which the system switches from the XTAL CTL mode to the SWtoXTAL mode.
The wait time is calculated as follows: (65536 – xtaltime) x T30K. T30K indicates the cycle of the 30 kHz low-frequency clock.
Note: To accelerate the switching from the doze mode to the slow mode, set this field to 0xFFFF. Then the system is stable after the crystal oscillator is powered on.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this field returns the written value.

RegisterGroup.name: SC_APLLCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: SC_APLLCTRL is an APLL control register. It is used to set the APLL stable wait time. TheAPLL clock frequency is controlled by the bits in SC_APLLFREQCTRL0 andSC_APLLFREQCTRL1.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this field returns 0 and writing this field has no effect.

Member.name: plltime
Member.description:
APLL stable wait time.
The wait time is the period during which the PLL output becomes stable after the PLL is started. In other words, the wait time is the period during which the system switches from the PLLCTL mode to the SWtoPLL mode.
The wait time is calculated as follows: (33554432 ? plltime) x TXIN. TXIN indicates the clock cycle of the external crystal oscillator.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this field returns 0 and writing this field has no effect.

RegisterGroup.name: SC_LOCKEN
RegisterGroup.description:
SC_LOCKEN is a write protection control register. SC_LOCKEN provides a write protectionmechanism for the following key registers of the system controller:
  • SC_CTRLSC_SYSRESSC_APLLCTRLSC_APLLFREQCTRL1SC_APLLFREQCTRL0SC_VPLL0FREQCTRL1SC_VPLL0FREQCTRL0SC_VPLL1FREQCTRL1SC_VPLL1FREQCTRL0SC_QPLLFREQCTRL1SC_QPLLFREQCTRL0When 0x4F50_454E is written to SC_LOCKEN, the write protection function of thepreceding key registers is disabled and their attributes are changed to writable. Then theseregisters can be written. When any value but not 0x4F50_454E is written to SC_LOCKEN,the attributes of these registers are changed to read-only. Then writing to these registers has noeffect.You can also check whether the key registers are write-protected by reading SC_LOCKEN. Ifthe value 0x756E_4C4F is returned, the key registers are not write-protected and they can bewritten. If the value 0x4C4F_434B is returned, the key registers are write-protected andwriting to these registers has no effect.The reset value of SC_LOCKEN is 0x756E_4C4F, indicating that the key registers are notwrite-protected.

Member.name: sc_locken
Member.description: Write protection indicator of key system registers. For details, see the function description of SC_LOCKEN.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_LOAD
RegisterGroup.description:
TIMERx_LOAD is an initial count value register. It is used to set the initial count value ofeach timer. Each timer (timer0–timer7) has such a register.When a timer is in periodic mode and the count value reaches 0, the value of TIMERx_LOADis loaded to the timer. When a value is written to TIMERx_LOAD, the current count value ischanged to the written value on the next rising edge of the TIMCLK enabled byTIMCLKENx.NOTE
  • The minimum valid value written to TIMERx_LOAD is 1.
  • When 0 is written to TIMERx_LOAD, the dual-timer submodule immediately generates an interrupt.When a value is written to TIMERx_BGLOAD, the value of TIMERx_LOAD is overwritten,but the current count value of the timer is retained.If values are written to TIMERx_BGLOAD and TIMERx_LOAD before a rising edge of theTIMCLK enabled by TIMCLKENx, the value of the counter on the next rising edge ischanged to the value written to TIMERx_LOAD. Then each time the counter reaches 0, thelast values written to TIMERx_BGLOAD and TIMERx_LOAD are reloaded.If TIMERx_BGLOAD and TIMERx_LOAD are written twice respectively, readingTIMER0_LOAD returns the value written to TIMERx_BGLOAD.

Member.name: timer0_load
Member.description: Initial count value of timer0.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER1_LOAD
RegisterGroup.description:
TIMERx_LOAD is an initial count value register. It is used to set the initial count value ofeach timer. Each timer (timer0–timer7) has such a register.
When a timer is in periodic mode and the count value reaches 0, the value of TIMERx_LOADis loaded to the timer. When a value is written to TIMERx_LOAD, the current count value ischanged to the written value on the next rising edge of the TIMCLK enabled byTIMCLKENx.
NOTE

  • The minimum valid value written to TIMERx_LOAD is 1.
  • When 0 is written to TIMERx_LOAD, the dual-timer submodule immediately generates an interrupt.

When a value is written to TIMERx_BGLOAD, the value of TIMERx_LOAD is overwritten,but the current count value of the timer is retained.
If values are written to TIMERx_BGLOAD and TIMERx_LOAD before a rising edge of theTIMCLK enabled by TIMCLKENx, the value of the counter on the next rising edge ischanged to the value written to TIMERx_LOAD. Then each time the counter reaches 0, thelast values written to TIMERx_BGLOAD and TIMERx_LOAD are reloaded.
If TIMERx_BGLOAD and TIMERx_LOAD are written twice respectively, readingTIMER0_LOAD returns the value written to TIMERx_BGLOAD.

Member.name: timer1_load
Member.description: Initial count value of timer1.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_VALUE
RegisterGroup.description:
TIMERx_VALUE is a current count value register. It provides the current value of the counterthat is counting down. Each timer (timer0–timer7) has such a register.After a value is written to TIMERx_LOAD, TIMERx_VALUE immediately reflects the newlyloaded value of the counter in the PCLK domain without waiting for the next clock edge ofthe TIMCLK enabled by TIMCLKENx.NOTE
When a timer is in 16-bit mode, the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit TIMERx_VALUE are not automaticallyset to 0s. If TIMERx_LOAD is never written after the timer is switched from 32-bit mode to 16-bitmode, the upper 16 bits of TIMERx_VALUE may be non-zero values.

Member.name: timer0_value
Member.description: Current count value of timer0 that is counting down.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER1_VALUE
RegisterGroup.description:
TIMERx_VALUE is a current count value register. It provides the current value of the counterthat is counting down. Each timer (timer0–timer7) has such a register.
After a value is written to TIMERx_LOAD, TIMERx_VALUE immediately reflects the newlyloaded value of the counter in the PCLK domain without waiting for the next clock edge ofthe TIMCLK enabled by TIMCLKENx.
NOTE

When a timer is in 16-bit mode, the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit TIMERx_VALUE are not automaticallyset to 0s. If TIMERx_LOAD is never written after the timer is switched from 32-bit mode to 16-bitmode, the upper 16 bits of TIMERx_VALUE may be non-zero values.

Member.name: timer0_value
Member.description: Current count value of timer1 that is counting down.

Member.name: timerpre
Member.description:
Timer prescaling divider.
00: no prescaling. That is, the clock frequency of the timer is divided by 1.
01: 4-level prescaling. That is, the clock frequency of the timer is divided by 16.
10: 8-level prescaling. That is, the clock frequency of the timer is divided by 256.
11: undefined. If this field is set to 11, 8-level prescaling is used, meaning that the clock frequency of the timer is divided by 256.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_INTCLR

Each timer (timer0–timer7) has such a register.CAUTIONThis register is write-only. When a value is written to this register, the timer interrupts arecleared. No written value is recorded in this register and no default reset value is defined.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_BGLOAD
RegisterGroup.description: TIMERx_BGLOAD is an initial count value register in periodic mode. Each timer (timer0–timer7) has such a register.The TIMERx_BGLOAD register contains the initial count value of the timer. In periodicmode, this register is used to reload an initial count value when the count value of the timerreaches 0.In addition, this register provides another method of accessing TIMERx_LOAD. In thismethod, the timer does not immediately count from the written value after a value is written toTIMER0_BGLOAD

Member.name: timer0bgload
Member.description:
Initial count value of timer0.
Note: The count value is different from that of TIMERx_LOAD. For details, see the descriptions of TIMER1_XXXX, TIMER3_XXXX, TIMER5_XXXX, and TIMER7_XXXX have the same offset address. The following section describes these registers by using TIMER1_XXXX as an example.
.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER1_BGLOAD
RegisterGroup.description:
TIMERx_BGLOAD is an initial count value register in periodic mode. Each timer (timer0–timer7) has such a register.
The TIMERx_BGLOAD register contains the initial count value of the timer. In periodicmode, this register is used to reload an initial count value when the count value of the timerreaches 0.
In addition, this register provides another method of accessing TIMERx_LOAD. In thismethod, the timer does not immediately count from the written value after a value is written toTIMER0_BGLOAD

Member.name: timer1bgload
Member.description:
Initial count value of timer1.
Note: The count value is different from that of TIMERx_LOAD. For details, see the descriptions of TIMER1_XXXX, TIMER3_XXXX, TIMER5_XXXX, and TIMER7_XXXX have the same offset address. The following section describes these registers by using TIMER1_XXXX as an example.
.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_LOAD
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_LOAD is an initial count value register. It is used to configure the initial count valuefor the internal counter of the watchdog.

Member.name: wdg_load
Member.description: Initial count value.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_VALUE
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_VALUE is a current count value register. It is used to read the current count value ofthe internal counter of the watchdog.

Member.name: wdogvalue
Member.description: Current count value of the watchdog counter.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_CONTROL
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_CONTROL is a control register. It is used to enable or disable the watchdog andcontrol the interrupt and reset functions.

Member.name: resen
Member.description:
Reset output enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: inten
Member.description:
Interrupt output signal.
0: The counter stops counting, the current count value is retained, and the watchdog is disabled.
1: The counter, interrupt, and watchdog are enabled.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_INTCLR
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_INTCLR is an interrupt clear register. It is used to clear watchdog interrupts so thewatchdog can reload an initial value for counting. This register is write-only. When a value iswritten to this register, the watchdog interrupts are cleared. No written value is recorded inthis register and no default reset value is defined.

Member.name: wdg_intclr
Member.description: Writing any value to this register clears the watchdog interrupts and enables the watchdog to reload an initial count value from WDG_LOAD to restart counting.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_RIS
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_RIS is a raw interrupt status register. It shows the raw interrupt status of the watchdog.

Member.name: wdogris
Member.description:
Raw interrupt status of the watchdog. When the count value reaches 0, this bit is set to 1.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_MIS
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_MIS is a masked interrupt status register. It shows the masked interrupt status of thewatchdog.

Member.name: wdogmis
Member.description:
Masked interrupt status of the watchdog.
0: No interrupt is generated or the interrupt is masked.
1: An interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_LOCK
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_LOCK is a lock register. It is used to control the write and read permission for thewatchdog registers.

Member.name: wdg_lock
Member.description:
Writing 0x1ACC_E551 to this register enables the write permission for all the registers.
Writing any value but not 0x1ACC_E551 disables the write permission for all the registers.
Reading this register returns the lock status but not the value written to this register.
0x0000_0000: The write operation is allowed (unlocked).
0x0000_0001: The write operation is forbidden (locked).

Member.name: init_arefnum
Member.description:
Number of auto-refresh operations when the DDRn SDRAM is being initialized.
0x0–0x2: two times
0x3–0xF: n times

Member.name: pd_prd
Member.description:
Power down cycle configuration of the SDRAM low power. When the DDRC does not receive any command in continuous pd_prd cycles, it forces the DDRn SDRAM to enter the low-power mode; when a command is received, the DDRC forces the DDRn SDRAM to exit the low-power mode.
0x00: 1 clock cycle
0x01–0xFF: n clock cycles.
Note: This parameter is valid only when pd_en is 1.

Member.name: rcv_pdr
Member.description:
DDR receive I/O dynamic power down control enable. The DDRC disables the receive buffer of the DDR data I/O in the non-read status when it is enabled.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: sr_cc
Member.description:
DDRn SDRAM clock control in self-refresh mode.
0: The DDRn SDRAM clock is enabled.
1: The DDRn SDRAM clock is disabled.

Member.name: reserved

Reserved.
This bit can be set only to 0.

Member.name: pd_en

Automatic low-power enable of the DDRn SDRAM.

1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CONFIG1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CONFIG1 is DDRC function configuration register 1.

Member.name: sref_arefnum
Member.description:
Number of self-refresh operations after DDRn SDRAM exits self-refresh in DFS process.
0x0–0x1: one time
0x2–0xF: n times
Note: When train_en is 1, the configured value is valid. When train_en is 0, DDRn SDRAM exits self-refresh and the DDRC does not perform auto refresh operation.

Member.name: sref_zqc_en
Member.description:
ZQ calibration long enable when the DDR exits the self-refresh mode.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: This bit is valid for the DDR3 mode. If the DDR is in the self-refresh state for a long time, set this bit to 1. To avoid additional time consumption of the ZQCL, this bit must be set to 0 during DFS process.

Member.name: clk_switch
Member.description:
DDRC low power clock switch control. Whether to enable back pressure AXI interface command when DDRC enters low power status (DDR Self Refresh).
0: not back pressure command and return to error.
1: back pressure command and implement the original command when the clock is switched.

Member.name: odis_ddrio
Member.description:
Output disable configuration of the DDR command and data I/O.
0: enable the pin output
1: disable the pin output
Note: The configuration is a static configuration. After the DDR enters self-refresh status, this bit is recommended to be set to 1 to disable the DDR command and the data output of the I/O module. Before the DDR exits the self-refresh status, this bit is recommended to be set to 0 to enable the DDR command and the data output of the I/O module.

Member.name: pd_ac
Member.description:
SDRAM address command status enable control in power-down mode.
0: enable the pin output
1: disable the pin output
Note: When pd_en is enabled, the configured value is valid. The control pins exclude CKE, ODT, CSN, and RESET_N.

Member.name: pd_pst_opn
Member.description:
SDRAM address command pin enable delay in advance.
00: 0 beats
01: 1 beat
10: 2 beats
11: 3 beats
Note: When pd_en is enabled, the configured value is valid. The control pins exclude CKE, and RESET_N.

Member.name: pd_pre_cls
Member.description:
SDRAM address command enable delay after entering power-down mode.
00: 0 beats
01: 1 beat
10: 2 beats
11: 3 beats
Note: When pd_en is enabled, the configured value is valid. The control pins exclude CKE and RESET_N.

Member.name: auto_pre_en
Member.description:
Auto precharge function enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: wr_rcv_mode
Member.description:
Mode of receiving the write command over the DDRC AXI port.
0: The write command is received directly.
1: The write command is received only after the expected write data arrives.

Member.name: exclu_en
Member.description:
Exclusive command enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: lock_en
Member.description:
WRAP command lock enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: aref_mode
Member.description:
Auto-refresh mode select.
0: An auto-refresh operation is performed every one tREFI period.
1: Eight auto-refresh operations are performed every nine tREFI periods.

Member.name: dual_ch
Member.description:
DDRC dual channels enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: This bit can be set only to 0.

Member.name: read_mode
Member.description:
Read mode select of the DDRC.
0: associated read mode
1: delay read mode
The associated read mode is a mode in which the DDRC samples data based on the data valid signal from the PHY.
The delay read mode is a mode in which the DDRC samples the data from the PHY after the internal delay of the DDRC.
Note: This bit can be set only to 0.

Member.name: clkratio
Member.description:
Operating mode of the DDRC.
0: The ratio of the frequency of the DDRC to that of the PHY is 1:1.
1: The ratio of the frequency of the DDRC to that of the PHY is 1:2.

Member.name: zqc_en
Member.description:
DDR3 SDRAM ZQ enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: This bit is valid for the DDR3 SDRAM only and is set to 0 by default.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CMDCFG
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CMDCFG is a DDRC command configuration register.

Member.name: cmd_mrs
Member.description: Configuration value in DDR mode when LMR command is configured.

Member.name: cmd_ba
Member.description: Configured value of the DDR BA when the LMR command is configured.

Member.name: cmd_rank
Member.description:
Rank of running commands.
0: The configuration command is executed.
1: The configuration command is not executed.
Each bit controls one rank.

Member.name: cmd_type
Member.description:
DDR command configuration.
00: enter the deep power down mode
01: exit the deep power down mode
10: LMR command
11: ZQCL

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CMDEXE
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CMDEXE is a DDRC software configuration command start register.

Member.name: cmd_req
Member.description:
Request of executing the configuration command of the DDRC.
0: The command is not executed or the parameter is cleared automatically after the command is executed.
1: The command is requested to be executed.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_RNKCFG
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_RNKCFG is a DDR feature configuration register.

Member.name: mem_map
Member.description:
Address translation mode of the SDRAM.
00: {Rank,Row,Ba,Col,DW}= AXI_Address
01: {Rank,Ba,Row,Col,DW}= AXI_Address
10: {Rank,Row,Ba,Col,cs,Col,DW}= AXI_Address
11: {Rank,Ba,Row,Col,cs,Col,DW}= AXI_Address
This parameter can be set to 'b10 and 'b11 when DDRC_CONFIG1[dual_ch] is valid.
When there are multiple ranks, each rank is configured in the same way.

Member.name: mem_bank
Member.description:
Number of banks of a single SDRAM.
0: 4 banks
1: 8 banks
If there are multiple ranks, the ranks in the same channel can have different configurations. In dual-channel mode, the dual channels must have the same configuration.

Member.name: mem_row
Member.description:
Bit width of the row address of a single DDRn SDRAM.
000: 11 bits
001: 12 bits
010: 13 bits
011: 14 bits
100: 15 bits
101: 16 bits
Other values: reserved
If there are multiple ranks, the ranks in the same channel can have different configurations. In dual-channel mode, the dual channels must have the same configuration.

Member.name: mem_col
Member.description:
Bit width of the row address of a single DDR SDRAM.
000: 8 bits
001: 9 bits
010: 10 bits
011: 11 bits
100: 12 bits
Other values: reserved
If there are multiple ranks, the ranks in the same channel can have different configurations. In dual-channel mode, the dual channels must have the same configuration.
Note: The DDRC does not support the devices whose col address is less than 8. That is the 32-bit width LPDDR2 devices whose capacity is 64 Mbits.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING0 is DDR timing parameter register 0.

Member.name: tmrd
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of LMR.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
This parameter is set to max{tMRD,tMOD}.

Member.name: trrd
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from ACT bank A to ACT bank B.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trp
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of PRE.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trcd
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from ACT to READ or WRITE in the same bank.
0x0–0x3: 3 clock cycles
0x4–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trc
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from an ACT command to the next ACT in the same bank.
0x00–0x01: 1 clock cycle
0x02–0x3F: n clock cycles

Member.name: tras
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from ACT to PRE in the same bank.
0x00–0x01: 1 clock cycle
0x02–0x0F: n clock cycles

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING1 is DDR timing parameter register 1.

Member.name: tsre
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from the self-refresh exit command to the read command.
0x0: 1 clock cycle
0x01–0xFF: (n x 2) clock cycles
When the DDR3 SDRAM is used, the value is set to tXSDLL.

Member.name: trdlat
Member.description:
Inherent delay of the DDRPHY.
0x0–0xF: (n + 1) clock cycles
This field is valid when read_mode is 1 (delay read mode).

Member.name: trtw
Member.description:
Delay from the last read data segment to the first written data segment.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: (n + 1) clock cycles

Member.name: twl
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from the write command to the data write operation.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
For example, 0x3 indicates three clock cycles.
Note: twl is set to tcl-1 in DDR2 mode. The following condition must be met during twl configuration: twl – taond ≥ 1.

Member.name: tcl
Member.description:
DDR CL from the read command to the read data.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trfc
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of from AREF or AREF to ACT. The register can be set to the maximum value max{trfc,tzqcs}.
0x00–0x01: 1 clock cycle
0x02–0xFF: n clock cycles

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING2
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING2 is DDR timing parameter register 2.

Member.name: tcke
Member.description:
Minimum period of maintaining the low-power mode.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
The value is set to the maximum value among tCKESR, tCKSRE, tCKSRX, and tCKE.
When the Dophin DDRPHY is used, the value of this register needs to be set to (max{tCKSRx,tCKE} + 3).

Member.name: twtr
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of the last write-to-read command.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xf: n clock cycles
For example, 0x3 indicates three clock cycles.

Member.name: twr
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of write recovery.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xf: n clock cycles
Note: When DFS is required, the parameter of tWR must be set to the maximum frequency in the DFS and cannot change with the frequency of the DDR.

Member.name: tfaw
Member.description:
Number of clock cycles for four consecutive activation commands.
0x00–0x3F: n clock cycles
For example, 0x14 indicates one clock cycle.

Member.name: taref
Member.description:
Number of auto-refresh cycles.
0x000: Auto-refresh is disabled.
0x001–0x7FF: The auto-refresh cycle of the DDRn SDRAM is 16 x n clock cycles.
For example, 0x008 indicates 128 (16 x 8) clock cycles.
The configuration interval is as follows: tREFI = 7800/16/tclk. Tclk is the running cycle when SDRAM is used.
When DDRC_CONFIG1[aref_mode] is 1, the interval of DDRC_TIMING2 must be set to 8 x tREFI.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING3
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING3 is DDR timing parameter register 3.

Member.name: tzq_prd
Member.description:
Number of ZQCS command cycles.
0x000: The ZQCS command is disabled.
0x001–0x3FF: n x 128 AREF cycles
The number of ZQCS command cycle is equal to n x 128 taref clock cycles.

Member.name: tzqinit
Member.description:
Number of delay cycles during ZQ initialization.
0x0–0x1ff: (n + 1) clock cycles
The value is set to the larger value between tZQINIT and tDLLK.

Member.name: taond
Member.description:
Number of ODT enable/disable cycles.
In DDR2 mode (taond/taofd):
0x0: 2/2.5
0x1: 3/3.5
0x2: 4/4.5
0x3: 5/5.5
Others values: reserved
In DDR3 mode, the value is set to (tWL – 1).

Member.name: txard
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of exiting the DDR low-power mode.
0x0–0xF: n clock cycles. The letter n indicates the corresponding decimal value.
For example, 0x7 indicates seven clock cycles.
The value is set to the maximum value among tXP, tXARD, tXARDS, and tXS.
In DDR3 mode, when the register is set to tXS, txard only needs to be set to an equivalent clock cycle of 10 ns.

Member.name: trtp
Member.description:
Wait delay from the read command to the disable command.
000–010: 2 clock cycles
011–111: n clock cycles
Trtp is calculated as follows: Trtp = AL + BL/2 + Max (trtp,2) – 2.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_NXT_TIMING0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_NXT_TIMING0 is DDR timing parameter register 0 for switching frequency.

Member.name: tmrd_nxt
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of LMR.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trrd_nxt
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from ACT bank A to ACT bank B.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trp_nxt
Member.description:

0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trcd_nxt
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from ACT to READ or WRITE in the same bank.
0x0–0x3: 3 clock cycles
0x4–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trc_nxt
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from an ACT to the next ACT in the same bank.
0x00–0x01: 1 clock cycle
0x02–0x3F: n clock cycles

Member.name: tras_nxt
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from ACT to PRE in the same bank.
0x00–0x01: 1 clock cycle
0x02–0x0F: n clock cycles

Member.name: trtw_nxt

Member.name: twl_nxt

0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: tcl_nxt

0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trfc_nxt
Member.description:

0x00–0x01: 1 clock cycle
0x02–0xFF: n clock cycles

0x001–0x7FF: The auto-refresh cycle of the DDRn SDRAM is 16 x n clock cycles.

Member.name: tzqinit_nxt
Member.description:

Member.name: trtp_nxt

Wait delay from the read command to the disable command.

Member.description:
ID dynamic mapping enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: idmap_mode
Member.description:
ID mapping mode.
0: The id_map mapping mode configured by the register is used by default.
1: The QoS mapping mode is used. The AXI interface configures this mode in associated mode by running the read/write command. This mapping mode is valid only when its macro definition is enabled in the RTL code.

Member.name: id_order_ctl
Member.description:
Out-of –order execution enable of the specified ID
0: disabled
1: enabled
The DDRC does not ensure the order when the address conflict occurs between the specified ID read/write commands and other ID commands. Master ensures the data consistency.
Note: The configuration is valid only after the parameters of the corresponding macro definitions are configured in the codes.

Member.name: order_en
Member.description:
Execution order enable for the commands with the same priority.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: dmc_fifo_lvl
Member.description:
Depth of the command register FIFO in the DMC.
0x0–0xf: n + 1 commands
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_QOSCFG1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_QOSCFG1 is DDRC QoS algorithm configuration register 0.

Member.name: id_map_rd
Member.description:
For the read command, QoS that is configured by selecting four bits based on the bus read ID.
Bit[15:12]: bit[3] mapping to the ID
Bit[11:8]: bit[2] mapping to the ID
Bit[7:4]: bit[1] mapping to the ID
Bit[3:0]: bit[0] mapping to the ID
For example, if ID_MAP is set to 0x5320, ID[5], ID[3], ID[2], and ID[0] of the bus ID are used for ID mapping and priority configuration.
The DDRC inserts three bits between the ninth bit, eighth bit and seventh bit of the existing 13-bit ID. These three bits indicate the AXI port numbers. Therefore, the bit width of the ID mapped by the DDRC is 16 bits.
000: AXI port 0
001: AXI port 1
010: AXI port 2
011: AXI port 3
100: AXI port 4
101: AXI port 5
110: AXI port 6
111: AXI port 7

Member.name: id_map_wr
Member.description:
For the read command, QoS that is configured by selecting four bits based on the bus write ID.
Bit[15:12]: bit[3] mapping to the ID
Bit[11:8]: bit[2] mapping to the ID
Bit[7:4]: bit[1] mapping to the ID
Bit[3:0]: bit[0] mapping to the ID
For example, if ID_MAP is set to 0x5320, ID[5], ID[3], ID[2], and ID[0] of the bus ID are used for ID mapping and priority configuration.
The DDRC inserts three bits between the ninth bit, eighth bit and seventh bit of the existing 13-bit ID. These three bits indicate the AXI port numbers. Therefore, the bit width of the ID mapped by the DDRC is 16 bits.
000: AXI port 0
001: AXI port 1
010: AXI port 2
011: AXI port 3
100: AXI port 4
101: AXI port 5
110: AXI port 6
111: AXI port 7

RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_QOS is a DDRC command priority configuration register.

Member.name: pri_apt
Member.description:
Command priority adaptation configuration.
0x0: disabled
0x1–0xF: (n x 16) clock cycles

Member.name: age_prd
Member.description:
Command aging cycle configuration.
0x0: disabled
0x1–0xF: (n x 16) clock cycles

Member.name: qos_en
Member.description:
Command QoS enable (timeout).
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: qos
Member.description:
Command QoS configuration (timeout).
0x1–0x3FF: n clock cycles
Other values: reserved
Note: The used timeout value is an integer multiple of 16. The lower four bits of rd_qos is ignored.

Member.name: pri
Member.description:
Command priority configuration.
000: highest
001: higher
…
111: lowest.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_FLUX
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_FLUX is a DDRC AXI port bandwidth control configuration register.

Member.name: flux_port_en
Member.description:
AXI interface DDRC traffic count enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: flux_ovfl
Member.description:
AXI interface traffic overflow enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
When this bit is set to 1, the AXI port traffic exceeds the bandwidth limit, no traffic overflow AXI port exists, and a command request is sent, the bandwidth of the AXI port can exceed the configuration traffic.

Member.name: flux_lvl
Member.description:
Whether to allow the AXI interface traffic overflows the threshold.
0x0–0x10: allow
Other values: reserved
When the AXI interface traffic exceeds the configuration bandwidth, flux_ovfl is 1, and the number of commands to be processed in DMA is less than the configuration threshold, the traffic overflow is allowed.

Member.name: flux
Member.description:
Bandwidth configuration allowed by the AXI interface.
0x0–0x3FF: the ratio of maximum DDR bandwidth accessed by the AXI interface to the total bandwidth. The total bandwidth is 1024. The configuration value is (traffic of this port/total bandwidth x 1024). For example, if the traffic of this port is 20% of the total bandwidth of the DDR, the value of flux is set to 0xCD.
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST0 is a DDRC test status register.

Member.name: dmc_ct
Member.description: Controller command type.

Member.name: dmc_cv
Member.description: Commands that are being processed by DDRC.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST7
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST7 is a DDRC performance statistics control register.

Member.name: perf_mode
Member.description:
Performance count mode.
0: continuous trigger mode. The performance-related counter continuously counts the performance. Ensure that no data overflows within 1s count (533 MHz) in continuous count mode.
1: single trigger mode
When the performance counter reaches the value of perf_prd, the count result is remained and the count is stopped.
Note: When an overflow occurs (that is, the count value reaches the value of perf_prd), the count values wrap.

Member.name: perf_en
Member.description:
Performance count enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: When perf_mode is 0 and this bit is enabled, performance count register starts the cyclic count. When perf_mode is 1, this bit is cleared after one count is complete.

Member.name: perf_ch
Member.description:
Channels for counting the read and write commands.
00: disabled
01: channel 0
10: channel 1
11: all channels
Other values: reserved
Note: This field limits the number of channels for counting the read and write commands of DDRC_TEST8 and DDRC_TEST9.
Note: This bit can be set only to 00 or 01.

Member.name: perf_prd
Member.description:
Performance count cycle.
0x0–0xFFFFFFF: count cycle
The actual count cycle is perf_prd x 4 x tclk (tclk is the bus clock cycle of the DDRC).
Note: This configuration is valid only when perf_mode is 1. When perf_mode is 0, the performance counters keep on counting performance.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST8
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST8 is a DDRC write command statistics register.

Member.name: wr_num
Member.description:
Number of write commands within the count limit. This field is set to 0.
Wrap cycle count is supported.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST9
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST9 is a DDRC read command statistics register.

Member.name: rd_num
Member.description:
Number of read commands within the count limit. This field is set to 0.
Wrap cycle count is supported.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST10
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST10 is a DDRC DMC command wait number statistics register.

Member.name: dmc_cmd_num
Member.description:
Number of DMC commands that are waiting in the DDRC within the count limit. This field is set to 0.
Wrap cycle count is supported.
Note: To ensure an overflow does not occur within 1s in 533 MHz, this bit must be limited by the register bit width. The count result displayed by this register is obtained by dividing the actual count result by 2.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_CON
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_CON is a NANDC configuration register.

Member.name: randomizer_en
Member.description:
Randomizer enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ecc_type
Member.description:
ECC mode selection.
000: non-ECC mode
001: 1-bit mode (The 1-bit ECC mode is internally switched to the 4-bit ECC mode.)
010: 4-bit mode
011: 8-bit mode
100: 24-bit mode
101: 40-bit mode
Other values: reserved
The reset value depends on the NFC_ECC_TYPE pin.

Member.name: rb_sel
Member.description:
Ready/busy signal select. It is valid when multiple external NAND flash memories (multiple CSs) are connected.
0: The NAND flash memories share a ready/busy signal.
1: The NAND flash memories each has its own ready/busy signal.
When only one NAND flash memory is connected, only cs0 and ready/busy 0 are used.

Member.name: cs_ctrl
Member.description:
CS control.
0: When the NAND flash is busy, the CS signal is fixed at 0.
1: When the NAND flash is busy, the CS signal is set to 1.
This mode maps to the "CS don't care" mode of the NAND flash.

Member.name: bus_width
Member.description:
Data line width of the NAND flash.
0: 8 bits
1: 16 bits
The reset value depends on the pin NFC_BUS_WIDE.

Member.name: pagesize
Member.description:
Page size of the NAND flash.
000: reserved
001: 2 KB
010: 4 KB
011: 8 KB
100: 16 KB
101–111: reserved
The reset value depends on the pin NFC_PAGE_SIZE.

Member.name: op_mode
Member.description:
Operating mode of the NANDC.
0: boot mode
1: normal mode

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_PWIDTH
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_PWIDTH is a read/write pulse width configuration register.

Member.name: rw_hcnt
Member.description:
High-level width of the read/write signal of the NAND flash.
0x0–0xF: 1–16 clock cycles

Member.name: r_lcnt
Member.description:
Low-level width of the read signal of the NAND flash.
0x0–0xF: 1–16 clock cycles

Member.name: w_lcnt
Member.description:
Low-level width of the write signal of the NAND flash.
0x0–0xF: 1–16 clock cycles

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_OPIDLE
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_OPIDLE is an operation interval configuration register.

Member.name: frb_wait
Member.description: Several delay cycles later after a read/write command is sent, the ready signal is detected to check whether it becomes high. Number of delay cycles = frb_wait x 8

Member.name: cmd1_wait
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles after command 1 is sent.
0000–1111: 1 to 16 clock cycles

Member.name: addr_wait
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles after addresses are sent.
Number of delay cycles = frb_wait x 8

Member.name: write_data_wait
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles after data is written.
0000–1111: 1 to 16 clock cycles

Member.name: cmd2_wait
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles after command 2 is sent.
0000–1111: 1 to 16 clock cycles

Member.name: wait_ready_wait
Member.description:
A read signal can be sent some delay cycles later after the ready signal of the NAND flash becomes high.
Number of delay cycles = frb_idle x 8

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_CMD
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_CMD is a command word configuration register.

Member.name: read_status_cmd
Member.description: Read status command word.

Member.name: cmd2
Member.description: Second command sent to the NAND flash by the NANDC.

Member.name: cmd1
Member.description: First command sent to the NAND flash by the NANDC.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_ADDRL
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_ADDRL is a low address configuration register.

Member.name: addr_l
Member.description: Lower 32-bit address of the NAND flash.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_ADDRH
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_ADDRH is a high address configuration register.

Member.name: addr_h
Member.description: Upper 8-bit address of the NAND flash.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_DATA_NUM
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_DATA_NUM is a read/written data count configuration register.

Member.name: nfc_data_num
Member.description:
Number of data segments that are read or written randomly by the NANDC. The maximum value is 9120 bytes.
This bit is valid only when ecc_type is set to 00.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_OP
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_OP is an operation register.

Member.name: address_cycles
Member.description: Number of address cycles sent to the NAND flash.

Member.name: nf_cs
Member.description:
NAND flash CS signal select.
00: CS0
Other values: reserved

Member.name: cmd1_en
Member.description:
Command 1 TX enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: addr_en
Member.description:
NAND flash address write enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: write_data_en
Member.description:
NAND flash data write enable.
Note: read_data_en and write_data_en cannot be 1 at the same time.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: cmd2_en
Member.description:
Command 2 TX enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: wait_ready_en
Member.description:
Wait ready/busy high enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: read_data_en
Member.description:
NAND flash data read enable.
Note: read_data_en and write_data_en cannot be 1 at the same time.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: read_status_en
Member.description:
When this bit is 1, the command 0x70 for reading the status is sent to the NAND flash and the status data is read from the NAND flash. After that, the returned data is written to the nfc_status field of the NANDC status register instead of the internal buffer.
After the NAND flash is erased or programmed, the result need to be read to check whether the operation is successful. If this bit is enabled, the erase or program operation can be performed at a time, and the data indicating whether the operation is successful can be returned from the NAND flash. In this way, the CPU intervention is reduced.
This bit is invalid when read_data_en is 1.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_STATUS
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_STATUS is a status register.

Member.name: nfc_randomizer_en
Member.description:
Randomizer enable in the NANDC.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: nfc_ecc_type
Member.description:
ECC information in the NANDC.
The read value indicates the same as the value of ecc_type in the NFC_CON register.

Member.name: nf_status
Member.description:
NAND flash status data read from the NAND flash.
This field is valid only when both NFC_OP[read_status] and NFC_STATUS[nfc_ready] are 1.

Member.name: nf3_ready
Member.description:
Status of the ready/busy signal of the NAND flash corresponding to CS3.
This bit is valid when multiple flash memories are connected and each has its own ready_busy signal.
The reset value of this bit is 0 because multiple NAND flash memories share a ready/busy signal by default.

Member.name: nf2_ready
Member.description:
Status of the ready/busy signal of the NAND flash corresponding to CS 2.
This bit is valid when multiple flash memories are connected and each has its own ready_busy signal.
The reset value of this bit is 0 because multiple NAND flash memories share a ready/busy signal by default.

Member.name: nf1_ready
Member.description:
Status of the ready/busy signal of the NAND flash corresponding to CS 1.
This bit is valid when multiple flash memories are connected and each has its own ready_busy signal.
The reset value of this bit is 0 because multiple NAND flash memories share a ready/busy signal by default.

Member.name: nf0_ready
Member.description:
Status of the ready/busy signal of the NAND flash corresponding to CS 0.
This bit is valid when multiple flash memories are connected and each has its own ready_busy signal.
The reset value of this bit is 0 because multiple NAND flash memories share a ready/busy signal by default.

Member.name: nfc_ready
Member.description:
Current NANDC status.
0: The controller is performing an operation.
1: The operation is complete and the controller is ready to receive the next command.
This bit is automatically cleared when the operation register is written to start the NANDC.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_INTEN
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_INTEN is an interrupt enable register.

Member.name: dma_err_en
Member.description:
DMA transfer bus error interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: dma_done_en
Member.description:
DMA transfer completion interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: wr_lock_en
Member.description:
Lock address write error interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ahb_op_en
Member.description:
NANDC buffer read/write error interrupt enable when the NANDC reads/writes data from/to the flash memory.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: err_invalid_en
Member.description:
Uncorrectable error interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: err_valid_en
Member.description:
Correctable error interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: cs3_done_en
Member.description:
Enable for the interrupt generated when the ready/busy signal corresponding to CS 3 changes from low to high.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: cs2_done_en
Member.description:
Enable for the interrupt generated when the ready/busy signal corresponding to CS 2 changes from low to high.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: cs1_done_en
Member.description:
Enable for the interrupt generated when the ready/busy signal corresponding to CS 1 changes from low to high.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: cs0_done_en
Member.description:
Enable for the interrupt generated when the ready/busy signal corresponding to CS 0 changes from low to high.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: op_done_en
Member.description:
Current operation completion interrupt enable of the NANDC.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_INTS
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_INTS is an interrupt status register.

Member.name: dma_err
Member.description:
DMA transfer bus error interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: dma_done
Member.description:
DMA transfer completion interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: wr_lock
Member.description:
Interrupt generated when the lock address is being written.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: ahb_op
Member.description:
Interrupt generated when the CPU reads and writes the NANDC buffer in the process of reading/writing data from/to the flash by the NANDC.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: err_invalid
Member.description:
Uncorrectable error interrupt.
Interrupt generated when errors occur in 8 or more bits of the checked 1024-byte data in 1-bit ECC mode.
Interrupt generated when errors occur in 8 or more bits of the checked 1024-byte data in 4-bit ECC mode.
Interrupt generated when errors occur in 16 or more bits of the checked 1024-byte data in 8-bit ECC mode.
Interrupt generated when errors occur in 24 or more bits of the checked 1024-byte data in 24-bit ECC mode.
Interrupt generated when errors occur in 40 or more bits of the checked 1024-byte data in 40-bit ECC mode.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: err_valid
Member.description:
Correctable error interrupt.
Interrupt generated when errors occur in 1 to 8 bits of the checked 1024-byte data in 1-bit ECC mode.
Interrupt generated when errors occur in 1 to 8 bits of the checked 1024-byte data in 4-bit ECC mode.
Interrupt generated when errors occur in 1 to 16 bits of the checked 1024-byte data in 8-bit ECC mode.
Interrupt generated when errors occur in 1 to 24 bits of the checked 1024-byte data in 24-bit ECC mode.
Interrupt generated when errors occur in 1 to 40 bits of the checked 1024-byte data in 40-bit ECC mode.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: cs3_done
Member.description:
Interrupt generated when the ready/busy signal corresponding to CS 3 changes from low to high. This bit is valid when two flash memories are connected and each has its own ready_busy signal. Otherwise, this bit is fixed at 0.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: cs2_done
Member.description:
Interrupt generated when the ready/busy signal corresponding to CS 2 changes from low to high. This bit is valid when two flash memories are connected and each has its own ready_busy signal. Otherwise, this bit is fixed at 0.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: cs1_done
Member.description:
Interrupt generated when the ready/busy signal corresponding to CS 1 changes from low to high. This bit is valid when two flash memories are connected and each has its own ready_busy signal. Otherwise, this bit is fixed at 0.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: cs0_done
Member.description:
Interrupt generated when the ready/busy signal corresponding to CS 0 changes from low to high. This bit is valid when two flash memories are connected and each has its own ready_busy signal. Otherwise, this bit is fixed at 0.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: op_done
Member.description:
Controller current operation completion interrupt.
This bit is automatically cleared when the NFC_OP register is written.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_ECC_TEST
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_ECC_TEST is an ECC test register.

Member.name: bb_err
Member.description:
Boot failure due to bad blocks.
0: No bad block.
1: Boot failure due to bad blocks.

Member.name: ecc_mask
Member.description:
ECC function mask.
1: The ECC check and correction are disabled. The structure of the data read from or written to the NAND flash is still converted based on the format of ecc_type.
0: Whether ECC check and correction are performed depends on the value of ecc_type.

Member.name: dec_only
Member.description:
Decoding only enable.
When 1 is written to this bit, ECC decoding is enabled, but the NAND flash is not read or written.
When this bit is read, the value 0 is returned.

Member.name: enc_only
Member.description:
Encoding only enable.
When 1 is written to this bit, ECC encoding is enabled, but the NAND flash is not read or written.
When this bit is read, the following values are returned:
1: The ECC encoding and decoding is complete.
0: The encoding and decoding are being performed.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_DMA_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_DMA_CTRL is a DMA control register.

Member.name: dma_rd_oob
Member.description:
Whether to read the OOB only or the whole page during the DMA read operation.
0: The whole page is read.
1: Only the OOB is read.

Member.name: wr_cmd_disable
Member.description:
Whether the write command is sent when the DMA write operation is selected.
0: The NANDC initiates a complete NAND flash write timing.
1: The NANDC initiates a write data timing but not a write command timing.
This bit is valid only when the NAND flash is written in DMA mode.

Member.name: dma_nf_cs
Member.description:
CS corresponding to the NAND flash that is selected for the DMA operation.
00: CS 0.
01: CS 1
10: CS 2
11: CS 3
Other values: reserved

Member.name: dma_addr_num
Member.description:
Number of addresses.
0: 5
1: 4

Member.name: burst16_en
Member.description:
Burst 16 enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: burst8_en
Member.description:
Burst 8 enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: burst4_en
Member.description:
Burst 4 enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: dma_wr_en
Member.description:
DMA read/write enable.
0: read
1: write

Member.name: dma_start
Member.description:
DMA operation start.
When 1 is written to this bit, the DMA operation is started. The bit retains 1 until the DMA operation is complete. Writing 0 to this bit has no effect.
After the DMA operation is started, if 0 is returned when this bit is read, the DMA operation is complete.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_BADDR_D

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_DMA_LEN

Member.name: len_oob
Member.description: Length of the OOB area when the NAND flash is written in DMA mode (4-byte aligned). This field is valid only in non-ECC mode. In other modes, the OOB length is fixed.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_OP_PARA

Member.name: oob_edc_en
Member.description:
OOB area check enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
In programming mode, an ECC code for the OOB area is generated.
In data read mode, the check function is enabled.

Member.name: data_edc_en
Member.description:
Data area check enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
In programming mode, an ECC code is generated.
In data read mode, the check function is enabled.

Member.name: oob_rw_en
Member.description:
Read/Write enable for the OOB area in the NAND flash.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: data_rw_en
Member.description:
Read/Write enable for the data area of the NAND flash.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: last_flag
Member.description:
As the internal buffer stores only 8 KB data at a time, this bit indicates whether the read/written data is in the first or the last 8 KB data segment when the flash memory page size is 16 KB.
0: The first 8 KB data segment is being read/written.
1: The last 8 KB data segment is being read/written.

Member.name: addr_num
Member.description:
Number of addresses sent to the NAND flash by the NANDC during booting.
0: 4 address cycles
1: 5 address cycles
The reset value depends on the NFC_ADDR_NUM pin.

Member.name: block_size
Member.description:
Block size of the NAND flash during booting.
00: 64 pages
01: 128 pages
10: 256 pages
11: 512 pages
The reset value depends on the NFC_BLOCK_SIZE pin.

RegisterGroup.name: NF_LP_CTRL

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_ERR_NUM0_BUF0
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_ERR_NUM0_BUF0 is NAND flash error bit count register 0.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Error bit count for the first 4 KB data during the first buffer operation of the NAND flash with the page size of 2 KB, 4 KB, 8 KB, or 16 KB.
bit[31:24]: number of error bits in the fourth 1 KB data
bit[23:16]: number of error bits in the third 1 KB data
bit[15:8]: number of error bits in the second 1 KB data
bit[7:0]: number of error bits in the first 1 KB data

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_ERR_NUM1_BUF0
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_ERR_NUM1_BUF0 is NAND flash error bit count register 1.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Error bit count for the last 4 KB data during the first buffer operation of the NAND flash with the page size of 8 KB or 16 KB.
bit[31:24]: number of error bits in the eighth 1 KB data
bit[23:16]: number of error bits in the seventh 1 KB data
bit[15:8]: number of error bits in the sixth 1 KB data
bit[7:0]: number of error bits in the fifth 1 KB data

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_ERR_NUM0_BUF1
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_ERR_NUM0_BUF1 is NAND flash error bit count register 2.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Error bit count during the second buffer operation of the NAND flash with the page size of 16 KB.
bit[31:24]: number of error bits in the fourth 1 KB data
bit[23:16]: number of error bits in the third 1 KB data
bit[15:8]: number of error bits in the second 1 KB data
bit[7:0]: number of error bits in the first 1 KB data

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_ERR_NUM1_BUF1
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_ERR_NUM1_BUF1 is NAND flash error bit count register 3.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Error bit count during the second buffer operation of the NAND flash with the page size of 16 KB.
bit[31:24]: number of error bits in the eighth 1 KB data
bit[23:16]: number of error bits in the seventh 1 KB data
bit[15:8]: number of error bits in the sixth 1 KB data
bit[7:0]: number of error bits in the fifth 1 KB data

Member.name: is_ccm
Member.description:
Current mode.
1: CCM mode
0: VCM or ACM mode

Member.name: matype_addr
Member.description:
Register address for storing ISI stream information. Read MATTYPE[matype_out] to obtain the configured address and stream information.
matype_addr[4:0] is used to select streams.
When matype_addr[6:5]==2'b00, the output of MATTYPE[matype_out] is the stream ID.
When matype_addr[6:5]==2'b01, the output of MATTYPE[matype_out] is matype1 corresponding to the stream ID.
When matype_addr[6:5]==2'b1x, the output of MATTYPE[matype_out] is tmodcod corresponding to the stream ID.

RegisterGroup.name: TS_CTRL4
RegisterGroup.description: TS_CTRL4 is TS control register 4.

Member.name: isi_sel_vld
Member.description:
TS output selected by specifying the stream ID.
1: The output stream is the one specified by isi_sel.
0: The output stream is the first stream found.

Member.name: clk_auto
Member.description:
Automatic generating of the TS clock.
1: If there is only one stream in CCM mode, an even TS clock is generated based on the stream rate.
0: A fixed clock frequency is generated by using ts_clk_div.

Member.name: ts_clk_div
Member.description:
TS parallel clock that is obtained by dividing the system clock.
The frequency divider is calculated as follows: Frequency divider = {ts_clk_div[5:0], ts_clk_div_f[15:0]}/2^16
The value of the ts_clk_div field ranges from 8 to 31.

RegisterGroup.name: TS_CLK_DIV_F_L
RegisterGroup.description: TS_CLK_DIV_F_L is a TS clock low register.

Member.name: ts_clk_div_f_l
Member.description: ts_clk_f[7:0]. Lower bits of the decimal part of the TS parallel clock obtained by dividing the system clock.

RegisterGroup.name: TS_CLK_DIV_F_H
RegisterGroup.description: TS_CLK_DIV_F_H is a TS clock high register.

Member.name: ts_clk_div_f_h
Member.description: ts_clk_f[7:0]. Upper bits of the decimal part of the TS parallel clock obtained by dividing the system clock.

RegisterGroup.name: ISI_SEL

Member.description: TS output select when TS_CTRL4[isi_sel_vld] is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: MATTYPE

Member.name: matype_out
Member.description: ISI stream ID output.

RegisterGroup.name: ROLL_OFF
RegisterGroup.description: ROLL_OFF is a roll-off register.

Member.name: roll_off
Member.description:
Roll-off factor.
00: 0.35
01: 0.25
10: 0.20
11: reserved

Member.name: isi_num
Member.description: Number of searched ISI streams.

RegisterGroup.name: CRC_ERR
RegisterGroup.description: CRC_ERR is a CRC check register.

Member.name: crc_err
Member.description:
The actual PER is calculated as follows:
Actual PER = crc_err/1024 x 100%
This field is valid only for S2 signals. When the value of crc_err is less than 1 but is not 0, the field value is 1. When the value of crc_err is greater than 255, the field value is 255.

RegisterGroup.name: RST_WAIT
RegisterGroup.description: RST_WAIT is a reset wait register.

Member.name: crc_pkt_cnt
Member.description: Packet count for PER statistics. The actual packet count is crc_pkt_cnt x 1024. When crc_pkt_cnt is 0, the actual packet count is 1024.

Member.name: rst_wait
Member.description:
Reset wait.
When CLK_CNT[28:25] == rst_wait, a TS reset signal is generated. CLK_CNT is a counter that uses the FEC clock. CLK_CNT counts when the interface is abnormal.

RegisterGroup.name: FC_MAX_RELIABLE
RegisterGroup.description: FC_MAX_RELIABLE is a blind scanning carrier control register.

Member.name: fc_dlt_sel
Member.description: Maximum error for blind scanning. When the field value is 0, the error is 3.072 MHz. When the field value is added by 1, the error increases by 1.024 MHz.

Member.name: cbs_reliable
Member.description: A larger value indicates more reliable blind scanning and longer scanning time.

RegisterGroup.name: FS_SPAN

Member.name: fs_span
Member.description: Symbol rate search range when the fs is specified. The value 0 indicates 2^?9 x fs. When the field value is added by 1, the range is doubled.

RegisterGroup.name: AMP_MIN_FS

Blind scanning enable.

Blind scanning mode.

Member.name: cbs_rd_addr
Member.description:
Address for reading blind scanning results.
Multiple results are obtained for each blind scanning and stored in the RAM. Each result has the fs, fc, and reliability information (corresponding to some registers whose offset addresses range from 0xA9 to 0xAF).

Member.description: Blind scanning result reliability 2. A larger value indicates more reliable.

Member.name: sig_num

RegisterGroup.name: DSEC_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: DSEC_ADDR is a DSEC address register.

Member.name: dsec_addr
Member.description:
When dsec_addr[7] is 1, the current operation is a read operation. When dsec_addr[3] is 0, dsec_addr[2:0] specifies the address for storing the data to be transmitted.
When dsec_addr[3] is 1, dsec_addr[2:0] specifies the address for storing the data to be received.
When dsec_addr[7] is 0, the current operation is a write operation. When dsec_addr[3] is 0, dsec_addr[2:0] specifies the address for storing the data to be transmitted.
When dsec_addr[3] is 1, the address specified by dsec_addr[2:0] is invalid.

RegisterGroup.name: DSEC_DATA
RegisterGroup.description: DSEC_DATA is a DSEC data register.

Member.name: dsec_data
Member.description:
Transmit data or read the received data.
For details, see section 5.3.18 "TX."
If bit[1] in the first byte of the message to be transmitted is 1, the state machine in the DiSEqc automatically enters the RX state after transmission is complete.
For details, see section 5.3.18 "RX."

RegisterGroup.name: DSEC_RATIO_L
RegisterGroup.description: DSEC_RATIO_L is a DSEC frequency low register.

Member.description: Lower bits of the system clock frequency divider for generating a 22 kHz square wave. diseqc_ratio = fsys/22. The unit of fsys is kHz.

RegisterGroup.name: DSEC_RATIO_H
RegisterGroup.description: DSEC_RATIO_H is a DSEC frequency high register.

Member.name: dsec_ratio_h
Member.description: Upper bits of the system clock frequency divider for generating a 22 kHz square wave.

001: Consecutive 22 kHz square waves are transmitted.
010: A 0 tone burst is transmitted.

100: A complete DiSEqC message is transmitted.

Member.name: tx_nbit
Member.description:
Lower bits of the TX bit count provided by users.
The bit count ranges from 1 to 256.

RegisterGroup.name: TX_CTRL2
RegisterGroup.description: TX_CTRL2 is a TX control register.

Member.name: freq_swap
Member.description:
FSK high/low frequency corresponding to the TX/RX bit.
1: When the TX/RX bit is 1, the frequency is cf minus df. When the TX/RX bit is 0, the frequency is cf plus df.
0: When the TX/RX bit is 1, the frequency is cf plus df. When the TX/RX bit is 0, the frequency is cf minus df.

Member.name: tx_start
Member.description:
TX start enable.
This field is automatically cleared.

Member.name: tx_pad
Member.description:
Whether to add the frame header and CRC.
1: Header is added to the frame header and CRC is added to the frame tail based on the bit sequence provided by users.
0: Only the bit sequence provided by users is transmitted.

Member.name: tx_busy
Member.description: TX busy indicator.

Member.name: tx_done
Member.description: TX completion indicator.

Member.name: tx_nbit_h
Member.description: Upper bits of the TX bit count provided by users (excluding the header and CRC).

RegisterGroup.name: RX_NBIT_L
RegisterGroup.description: RX_NBIT_L is an RX control register.

Member.name: rx_nbit_l
Member.description: Lower bits of the length of the received FSK frames (excluding the header and CRC). The length unit is bit.

RegisterGroup.name: RX_CTRL2
RegisterGroup.description: RX_CTRL2 is an RX control register.

Member.name: rx_ena
Member.description:
FSK RX enable.
1: enabled
0: enabled
When this field is 1 and an FSK frame is successfully received, this field is automatically cleared. Set this field to 1 after reading the received data.

Member.name: rx_thresh
Member.description:
Energy threshold for signal detection.
The smaller the threshold is, the easier signals are detected.

Member.name: rx_done
Member.description: Indicator showing that an FSK packet is successfully received.

Member.name: rx_nbit_h
Member.description: Upper bits of the length of the received FSK frames. The length unit is bit.

RegisterGroup.name: FSK_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: FSK_ADDR is an FSK address register.

Member.name: fsk_addr
Member.description:
When FSK_ADDR bit[7] is 0, FSK_ADDR bit[4:0] specify the address for storing the data to be transmitted.
When FSK_ADDR bit[7] is 1, FSK_ADDR[4:0] specify the address for storing the data to be received.

RegisterGroup.name: FSK_DATA
RegisterGroup.description: FSK_DATA is an FSK data register.

Member.name: fsk_data
Member.description:
Transmit data or read the received data.
The TX procedure is as follows:
Step 1 Write data to FSK_DATA.
Step 2 Write a storage address to FSK_ADDR bit[4:0] and set FSK_ADDR bit[7] to 0.
Step 3 Repeat step 1 and step 2 until all user data is stored.
Step 4 Set head, crc_poly, nbit_head, nbit_crc, freq_swap, tcf_fc, df_fc, fs_fc, tx_pad, and tx_nbit.
Step 5 Set TX_CTRL2[tx_start] to 1.
Step 6 Wait until TX_CTRL2[tx_done] indicates that transmission is complete.
Step 7 Go to step 1 to start the next transmission.
----End
The RX procedure is as follows:
Step 1 Set head, crc_poly, nbit_head, nbit_crc, freq_swap, rcf_fc, df_fc, fs_fc, data1_flen, and flen.
Step 2 Set RX_CTRL2[rx_ena] to 1.
Step 3 Wait until RX_CTRL2[tx_done] indicates that reception is complete.
Step 4 Read rx_nbit to obtain the number of bytes of the received information (excluding the header and CRC). Currently, the value of rx_nbit must be a multiple of 8.
Step 5 Write a read address to FSK_ADDR bit[4:0] and set FSK_ADDR bit[7] to 1.
Step 6 Read FSK_DATA.
Step 7 Repeat step 5 and step 6 until all data is read.
----End

RegisterGroup.name: FSK_RX_LEN
RegisterGroup.description: FSK_RX_LEN is an FSK control register.

Member.name: data1_flen
Member.description:
Whether the received frame includes the frame length field.
1: include. The RX end uses the extracted frame length.
0: not include. The RX end uses the specified frame length flen.

Member.name: flen
Member.description: Number of specified RX bytes (excluding the header and CRC1 to CRC32).

RegisterGroup.name: MDIO_RWCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: MDIO_RWCTRL is an MDIO command word register. The register does not support softreset.

Member.name: cpu_data_in
Member.description:
Data that is written to the PHY by the MDIO module.
During writes, the CPU first writes the 16-bit data to be written by the MDIO module to this register.

Member.name: finish
Member.description:
PHY read/write operation completion indicator.
0: not complete
1: complete
When the second read/write operation is required, the CPU must clear this bit first.

Member.name: rw
Member.description:
PHY read or write access control.
0: read
1: write

Member.name: phy_exaddr
Member.description:
Physical address for the external PHY.
One MDIO interface can be used to read or write multiple external PHYs. Each PHY maps to one address. When only one external PHY is connected, this field is equivalent to UD_MDIO_PHYADDR[phy0_addr] or UD_MDIO_PHYADDR[phy1_addr].

Member.name: frq_dv
Member.description:
Clock divider of the MDC (MDIO interface clock) when the external PHY is read or written.
The following describes the mapping between frq_dv and MDC frequency by taking the frequency 100 MHz of the main clock as an example:
000: The frequency of the working main clock is divided by 50 and the obtained frequency is 2 MHz.
001: The working main clock is divided by 100 and the obtained frequency is 1 MHz.
010: The working main clock is divided by 150 and the obtained frequency is 682 kHz.
011: The working main clock is divided by 200 and the obtained frequency is 512 kHz.
100: The working main clock is divided by 250 and the obtained frequency is 409 kHz.
101: The working main clock is divided by 300 and the obtained frequency is 341 kHz.
110: The working main clock is divided by 350 and the obtained frequency is 292 kHz.
111: The working main clock is divided by 400 and the obtained frequency is 256 kHz.

Member.name: phy_inaddr
Member.description: Internal register address for the external PHY. This address is presented by a 5-bit binary number.

RegisterGroup.name: MDIO_RO_DATA
RegisterGroup.description: MDIO_RO_DATAMDIO is a read data register. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: cpu_data_out
Member.description: Data register used by the MDIO module to read the PHY. The MDIO module first writes the 16-bit data read from the PHY to this register.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_MDIO_PHYADDR

Member.name: phy_addr

UD_MDIO_ANEG_CTRLPHY is a PHY status offset address configuration register. Theregister does not support soft reset.NOTE
Assume that the PHY speed status is defined by bit[14] of the register whose address is 17. That is, ifinternal_addr_speed is set to 0x11 and speed_index is set to 0xE, the bit value can be read as the currentworking speed mode of the PHY over the MDIO interface.

Member.description: Address for the register in the PHY to store the status information (duplex). The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

Member.name: speed_index
Member.description: Offset address in the PHY status register that is used to store the speed information. The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

Member.name: link_index
Member.description: Offset address in the PHY status register that is used to store the link information. The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

Member.name: duplex_index
Member.description: Offset address in the PHY status register that is used to store the duplex information. The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

  • link_partner status change refers to the change of any bit of link, speed, and duplex.

Member.name: in_loop_en
Member.description:
Port inloop enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: Inloop and outloop cannot be enabled at the same time. When the network interface is in normal status, you need to soft-reset the ETH module after the normal status changes to inloop or outloop status.

Member.name: ex_loop_en
Member.description:
Port outloop enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: Inloop and outloop cannot be enabled at the same time. When the network interface is in normal status, you need to soft-reset the ETH module after the normal status changes to inloop or outloop status.

Member.name: pause_en

0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: rx_shframe_en
Member.description:
Port short frame RX enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: If rx_shframe_en is set to 1, the minimum length of the received frame is rx_min_thr. If rx_shframe_en is set to 0, the minimum frame length is 64 bytes (including CRC) by default.

Member.name: rx_min_thr
Member.description:
Minimum length of the received frame.
The value ranges from 42 bytes to 63 bytes. The default value is 42 bytes.
Note: If rx_min_thr is set to a value smaller than 42, 42 is used.

Member.name: len_max
Member.description:
Maximum length of the received frame. The default value is 1518 bytes.
The value ranges from 1518 bytes to 1535 bytes.
Note: If len_max is set to a value greater than 2000, 2000 is used. If len_max is set to a value smaller than 256, 256 is used.

  • If the highest byte of a destination MAC address is odd, the frame is a multicast frame.
  • If all bytes of a destination MAC address are 0xFF, the frame is a broadcast frame.

Member.name: out_edian

RegisterGroup.name: GLB_IRQ_STAT
RegisterGroup.description: GLB_IRQ_STAT is an interrupt status register. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: int_mdio_finish
Member.description:
Whether the MDIO interface completes the CPU operation.
0: The MDIO interface does not complete the CPU operation.
1: The MDIO interface completes the CPU operation and an interrupt is generated.
After this interrupt program starts, software determines whether the MDIO interface completes the operation by querying MDIO_RWCTRL[finish].

Member.name: int_rxd_up
Member.description:
Interrupt enable (multi-packet interrupt) for frames on the ETH MAC port to be received by the CPU.
0: invalid
1: The interrupt is valid. There are frames to be received by the CPU in the RX queue.
After this interrupt program starts, software determines whether there are frames to be received by querying GLB_IRQ_RAW[iraw_rxd_up].

Member.name: int_freeeq_up
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the TX queue changes from non-empty to empty. If this interrupt is generated, the CPU writes a new group of frames to be transmitted.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated when the TX queue changes from non-empty to empty.
After this interrupt program starts, software determines whether the current TX queue is empty by querying UD_GLB_ADDRQ_STAT[eq_cnt]. If the current TX queue is not empty, the interrupt is invalid.

Member.name: int_stat_up
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating whether the port status changes. This interrupt is generated when the MDIO auto-negotiates with the changes in the speed, duplex mode, and link status of the PHY.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: A port status change interrupt is generated.
After this interrupt program starts, software determines which status changes based on the configuration of UD_MDIO_IRQENA.

Member.name: int_duplex_up
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating whether the ETH duplex status changes.
0: The ETH duplex mode is not changed.
1: The ETH duplex status changes and an interrupt is generated.
After this interrupt program starts, software determines whether the duplex mode changes by querying UD_MAC_STAT_CHANGE[duplex_stat_ch].

Member.name: int_speed_up
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating whether the ETH speed status changes.
The ETH speed mode is not changed.
1: The speed mode changes and an interrupt is generated.
After this interrupt program starts, software determines whether the speed mode changes by querying UD_MAC_STAT_CHANGE[speed_stat_ch].

Member.name: int_link_up
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating whether the ETH link status changes
The ETH link status is not changed.
1: The ETH link status changes and an interrupt is generated.
After this interrupt program starts, software determines whether the link status changes by querying UD_MAC_STAT_CHANGE[link_stat_ch].

Member.name: int_tx_up
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating whether the ETH MAC port has transmitted a frame received from the CPU.
The ETH MAC port has not transmitted a frame.
1: The ETH MAC port has transmitted a frame and an interrupt is generated.
After this interrupt program starts, software determines whether to release the buffer space of the transmitted frame by querying the current TX queue address eq_out_index in UD_GLB_QSTAT.

Member.name: int_rx_up
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating whether there is a frame in the ETH to be received by the CPU.
0: invalid
1: The interrupt is valid. There are frames to be received by the CPU in the RX queue.
After this interrupt program starts, software determines whether there are frames to be received by querying GLB_IRQ_RAW[iraw_rxd_up].

Member.name: fw2cpu_up
Member.description:
Whether to forward the frames that are received from the ETH MAC port and hit the filter to the CPU port when the ETH MAC port enables this filter.
0: no
1: yes

Member.name: mac_m_up
Member.description:
Filter configuration control for the ETH MAC port (m = 0?7).
