Member.name: flt_mac_m
Member.description: Upper 16 bits of filter table MACm(m = 0?7).

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_IRQN_SET
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_IRQN_SET is a multi-packet interrupt configuration register. The register does notsupport soft reset.

Member.name: int_frm_cnt
Member.description:
This field is used to set the multi-packet interrupt function. That is, this field defines the number of packets to be received before a multi-packet interrupt is reported.
Note: The minimum value of int_frm_cnt is 1. In this case, the multi-packet interrupt is equivalent to the single-packet interrupt.

Member.name: age_timer
Member.description:
After the multi-packet interrupt function is enabled, if the number of received packets cannot reach the specified value required for reporting the multi-packet interrupt after a period, this period is defined as the aging time for generating the multi-packet interrupt.
Note: age_timer is counted in the unit of the cycle of the main clock divided by 256.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_QLEN_SET
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_QLEN_SET is a queue length configuration register. The register does not supportsoft reset.

Member.name: iq_len
Member.description:
RX (packet receiving) queue length configuration.
Note: iq_len cannot be set to 0; otherwise, it is forcibly set to 1. The sum of iq_len and eq_len cannot be greater than 64. Otherwise, iq_len (non-zero) takes priority over eq_len and eq_len is iq_len subtracted from 64.

Member.name: eq_len
Member.description:
TX (packet transmitting) queue length configuration.
Note: eq_len cannot be set to 0; otherwise, it is forcibly set to 1.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_FC_LEVEL
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_FC_LEVEL is a traffic control register. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: qlimit_ena
Member.description:
Traffic control enable for the RX queue.
0: disabled (do not transmit a traffic control message based on the status of the RX queue).
1: enabled (transmit a traffic control message based on the status of the RX queue).

Member.name: qlimit_up
Member.description:
Upper limit of traffic control for the RX queue. When the available space of the RX queue is less than the upper limit, a traffic control message is transmitted to the peer end if the traffic control for the RX queue is enabled.
Note: If the upper limit qlimit_up is set to 0, the RX queue fails to enter the traffic control status.
The upper limit qlimit_up must be less than the lower limit qlimit_down.

Member.name: qlimit_down
Member.description: Lower limit of traffic control for RX queue. When the available space of the RX queue is greater than or equal to the lower limit, the current traffic control is disabled if the RX queue is in traffic control status.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_CAUSE
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_CAUSE is a register for reporting causes to the CPU. The register does notsupport soft reset.

Member.name: mact_cause
Member.description:
Packet matching result types by querying the MAC table.
000: forcible forwarding
001: packet whose destination MAC address is the local MAC address
010: broadcast packet
011: packet matching the MAC table
100: multicast packet not matching the MAC table
101: unicast packet not matching the MAC table
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_RXFRM_SADDR
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_RXFRM_SADDR is an RX frame start address register. The register does notsupport soft reset.

Member.name: rxfrm_saddr
Member.description: Start address for a received frame.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_IQFRM_DES
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_IQFRM_DES is an RX frame descriptor register. The register does not supportsoft reset.

Member.name: fd_in_addr
Member.description: Relative address for the first frame to be received in the RX queue. It serves as the index (0 to iq_len ? 1) of the absolute storage address for the frame.

Member.name: fd_in_len
Member.description: Length of the frame to be received in the RX queue.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_IQ_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description:
UD_GLB_IQ_ADDR is an RX frame start address register. The register does not support softreset.NOTE
If the address allocated by software is not word-aligned, the logic writes data based on the word-alignedaddress. In this case, the previously written data is invalid. For example, if the configured start addressfor a frame is 0xF000_8002 (non word-aligned address), the logic writes 0x00 or other data to both the0xF000_8000 and 0xF000_8001 addresses. Then, the logic writes the first byte (valid data) of thereceived frame to 0xF000_8002, writes the second byte (valid data) of the received frame to0xF000_8003, and writes the subsequent data to the buffer in sequence. The similar method is used forother non-word-aligned addresses.

Member.name: startaddr_iq
Member.description: Start address (configured by the CPU) for the storage space corresponding to a received frame. The received frame applies for the bus based on this address.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_BFC_STAT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_BFC_STAT is a counter register for the traffic control status of the forward bufferand aging time of the multi-packet interrupt. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: timerover_cnt
Member.description:
Count of multi-packet interrupt aging time counter overflow events (the count reaches the configured value).
Note: If the value of timerover_cnt is too large during a period of time,
UD_GLB_IRQN_SET[int_frm_cnt] is inappropriate. The multi-packet interrupt is triggered by the aging time. Therefore, the configured value must be decreased.

Member.name: flowctrl_cnt
Member.description:
Count that the forward buffer of the ETH MAC port enters the traffic control status.
Note: If the value of flowctrl_cnt is too large during a period of time, UD_GLB_FC_LEVEL[blimit_up] or UD_GLB_FC_LEVEL[blimit_down] is too small, or the external network deteriorates. In this case, the configured value may need to be reduced.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_EQ_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description:
UD_GLB_EQ_ADDR is a TX queue start address register. The register does not support softreset.NOTE
If the start address for a transmitted frame is not word-aligned, the logic reads data based on the wordaligned address. In this case, the previously read data is dropped due to invalidity. For example, if theconfigured start address for a transmitted frame is 0xF000_8102 (non word-aligned address), the logicdirectly drops the bytes read from the 0xF000_8100 and 0xF000_8101 addresses. Then, the logicconsiders the data read from 0xF000_8102 as the first byte (valid data) of the transmitted frame andconsiders the data read from 0xF000_8103 as the second byte (valid data) of the transmitted frame. Allsubsequent data is valid until the data of the specified frame length is read. The similar method is usedfor other non-word-aligned addresses.

Member.name: add_fd_addr_out
Member.description: Start address for the transmitted frame added by the CPU to the TX queue.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_EQFRM_LEN
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_EQFRM_LEN is a TX queue frame length configuration register. The registerdoes not support soft reset.

Member.name: add_fd_len_out
Member.description:
Length of a transmitted frame that is added to the TX queue by the CPU.
This register is configured to trigger hardware to write the start address and length of the transmitted frame to the TX queue for transmission. When transmitting a frame, software must write its start address and the frame length in sequence.
Note: The frames whose add_fd_len_out is less than 20 bytes or greater than 1600 bytes are dropped. That is, the length of the allowed frame must range from 20 bytes to 1600 bytes.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_QSTAT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_QSTAT is a queue status register. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: iq_in_index
Member.description: RX index of the RX (packet receiving) queue.

Member.name: cpuw_index
Member.description: RX index of the frame start address for the RX (packet receiving) queue.

Member.name: eq_in_index
Member.description: RX index of frame descriptors in the TX (packet transmitting) queue.

Member.name: eq_out_index
Member.description: TX index of frame descriptors in the TX (packet transmitting) queue.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_ADDRQ_STAT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_ADDRQ_STAT is an address queue status register. The register does not supportsoft reset.

Member.name: cpuaddr_in_rdy
Member.description:
Whether the CPU can configure the frame start address for the RX queue.
0: no
1: yes
Note: cpuaddr_in_rdy and eq_in_rdy are set to 0 during reset. However, they are immediately set to 1 by the circuit after reset. That is, the iq address queue and eq descriptor queue are configurable after reset.

Member.name: eq_in_rdy
Member.description:
Whether the CPU can configure the frame descriptor (start address and length) of the TX queue.
0: no
1: yes

Member.name: cpu_cnt
Member.description: Start address number for available frames assigned by the CPU to the RX queue.

Member.name: iq_cnt
Member.description: Used length of the RX queue (0 to iq_len).

Member.name: eq_cnt
Member.description: Used length of the TX queue (0 to eq_len).

Member.name: flux_timer_inter
Member.description: Traffic limit timeslot counter, which is used to count the main clock. The default count is 100000. For a 100-MHz main clock, the timeslot is 1 ms.

RegisterGroup.name: RAW_CFG_ERR

Member.name: iraw_oq_ovfl_err

1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iraw_fq_ovfl_err
Member.description:
If an overflow occurs in a free descriptor queue and the current descriptor is invalid during PES and section data processing, a raw error interrupt is generated because the overflow cannot be processed.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iraw_fq_desc_err
Member.description:
Status of the raw free descriptor configuration error interrupt. This interrupt is generated when the maximum size of the buffer corresponding to a free descriptor is smaller than the length of the section data.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iraw_fq_cfg_err
Member.description:
Status of the raw free descriptor queue configuration error interrupt. This interrupt is generated when a free descriptor queue is configured to be used in an output descriptor queue, but the free descriptor queue is disabled.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

This bit is 1 after reset deassertion. After 40 clock cycles, this bit is automatically changed to 0 and the value 0 is retained until the next reset.

RegisterGroup.name: OQ_INIT_DONE
RegisterGroup.description: OQ_INIT_DONE is a logic automatic initialization completion indicator register for outputdescriptor queues.

Member.name: oq_init_done
Member.description:
Logic automatic initialization completion indicator of output descriptor queues.
1: The logic is being initialized.
0: The logic has been initialized.
This bit is 1 after reset deassertion. After 128 clock cycles, this bit is automatically changed to 0 and the value 0 is retained until the next reset.

RegisterGroup.name: FQ_WR_MASK
RegisterGroup.description: FQ_WR_MASK is a write mask configuration register for free descriptor queues.

Member.name: fq_msk_ena
Member.description:
This bit is valid only when a free descriptor queue is enabled. When this bit is enabled, the fq_mask bit is valid. Then you can write to any domain of the word of a free descriptor queue by controlling the fq_mask bit. Otherwise, you can write to only the write pointer domain of the free descriptor queue.
1: Any domain of a free descriptor queue can be forcibly written.
0: Any domain of a free descriptor queue cannot be forcibly written.

Member.name: fq_mask
Member.description:
Mask bit when a free descriptor queue is being written. Bits 3?0 correspond to bits 31?24, bits 23?16, bits 15?8, and bits 7?0 respectively.
1: Eight bits are masked to avoid from being written.
0: not masked

RegisterGroup.name: OQ_WR_MASK
RegisterGroup.description: OQ_WR_MASK is a write mask configuration register for output descriptor queues.

Member.name: oq_msk_ena
Member.description:
When an output descriptor queue is enabled, you can configure this bit to forcibly set a mask bit by using the software. Then you can write to a specified word. Otherwise, you can only write to a specified domain of the output descriptor queue by using the software. When no output descriptor queue is enabled, this bit is unavailable.
1: Any domain of an output descriptor queue can be written forcibly.
0: Any domain of an output descriptor queue cannot be written forcibly.

Member.name: oq_mask
Member.description:
Mask bit when an output descriptor queue is being written. Bits 3?0 correspond to bits 31?24, bits 23?16, bits 15?8, and bits 7?0 respectively.
1: Eight bits are masked to avoid from being written.
0: not masked

Member.name: clear_type
Member.description: If the buffer channel to be cleared is bound to a playing channel, this bit is set to 0. If the buffer channel to be cleared is bound to a recording channel, this bit is set to 1. If the buffer channel to be cleared is bound to an index channel, this bit is set to 2.

Member.name: clear_start
Member.description: Channel clear operation start. The channel clear operation is started when this bit is set to 1. After the clear operation, the logic automatically clears this bit.

Member.description: ID of the channel to be cleared.

0: The data returned after the read operation is consistent with the written data.

RegisterGroup.name: IPX_SYNC_TH_CFG
RegisterGroup.description: IPx_SYNC_TH_CFG is a sync detection configuration register for IP channel 0.

Member.name: ipx_sync_type
Member.description:
Sync detection type of the IP channel.
0: nosync188. The packet length specified in 0xC8C0 bit[7:0] is synchronously detected.
1: nosync204. The packet length specified in 0xC8C0 bit[15:8] is synchronously detected.
2: nosync188_204. The packet lengths specified in 0xC8C0 bit[15:8] and 0xC8C0 bit[7:0] are synchronously detected.
3: unknown. A packet length range is synchronously detected based on the settings of 0xC8C0 bit[31:16].

RegisterGroup.name: TS_INTERFACE
RegisterGroup.description: TS_INTERFACE is an interface register.

Member.name: port_sel
Member.description:
Port enable.
0: disabled
1:enabled
The configuration parameters of a port can be modified only when the port is disabled.

Member.name: bit_sel
Member.description:
Input bit select.
0: cdata[7] is the parallel MSB or single-bit serial data line.
In 2-bit serial mode, cdata[7:6] are the data lines.
1: cdata[0] is the parallel MSB or single-bit serial data line.
In 2-bit serial mode, cdata[0:1] are the data lines.

Member.name: serial_sel
Member.description:
Serial/Parallel input select.
0: parallel input
1: serial input

Member.name: sw_ser_lsb_1st
Member.description:
1: The serial LSB is first input.
0: The serial MSB is first input.

Member.name: sw_47_replace
Member.description:
1: The sync byte is replaced with 47.
0: No byte is replaced.

Member.name: err_pol
Member.description:
Port err signal polarity select.
0: A data error occurs when the err signal is high.
1: A data error occurs when the err signal is low.

Member.name: vld_pol
Member.description:
Port vld signal polarity select.
0: active high
1: active low

Member.name: sync_pol
Member.description:
Sync signal polarity select of the S port.
0: active high
1: active low

Member.name: err_bypass
Member.description:
Port err signal mask select. After the signal is masked, the input err values are not sampled and considered as invalid values.
0: not mask
1: mask

Member.name: sync_mode
Member.description:
Parallel input mode select.
00: sync/burst mode
01: sync/valid mode
10: nosync_fixed mode. The length of each detected packet is specified by nosync_fixed_204.
11: nosync_188_204 mode. The hardware needs to check whether the packet length is 204 bytes or 188 bytes.

Member.name: nosync_fixed_204
Member.description:
Valid in nosync_fixed mode only.
0: 188-byte packets are detected.
1: 204-byte packets are detected.

Member.name: ser_nosync
Member.description:
Serial nosync mode select.
0: The sync line is valid.
1: The sync line is invalid (adaptive sync).
This bit is valid only when serial_sel is 1.

Member.name: ser_2bit_rev
Member.description:
Data line reverse select in 2-bit serial mode.
0: The 2-bit data line is not reversed.
1: The 2-bit data line is reversed.
This bit is valid only when serial_sel and ser_2bit_mode are 1.

010: CRC32 check is performed, and the packets with CRC errors are sent.

Member.name: fmt_8_4_para
Member.description:
4-bit format that is converted from the 8-bit format.
000: ARGB 4444
001: ARGB 1555
010: RGB 565
011: RGB 555
100: RGB 444
Other values: reserved

Member.name: fmt_add_a_para
Member.description:
Transparent color processing mode when channel A is added.
0: Do not use the transparent color.
1: Use the transparent color.

Member.name: fmt_16_8_para
Member.description:
Processing mode when a 16-bit format is converted into an 8-bit format.
0: Discard the lower eight bits.
1: Process based on the formula H8 + ((L8–H8 > 128) ? 1:0).
Where, H8 indicates upper eight bits, and L8 indicates lower eight bits.

Member.name: fmt_8_para
Member.description:
Mode of stuffing lower bits when a 1-bit, 2-bit, or 4-bit format is converted into an 8-bit format.
0: Stuffed with 0.
1: Stuffed with the previous valid bit repeatedly.

Member.name: fmt_8_4
Member.description:
Mode of converting other formats into the 4-bit format.
0: No change.
1: Set bit[7:0] to ARGB8888 and convert the format into a 4-bit format

Member.name: fmt_16_8
Member.description:
Bit depth conversion.
0: No change.
1: Convert the 16-bit depth into the 8-bit depth.

Member.name: fmt_swap_a
Member.description:
A sequence change (8 bits or 16 bits).
0: No change.
1: ABGR > BGRA/AGray > GrayA

Member.name: fmt_swap_rgb
Member.description:
RGB sequence change (8 bits or 16 bits).
0: No change.
1: BGR > RGB

Member.name: fmt_del_a
Member.description:
Processing mode when channel A is deleted (8 bits or 16 bits).
0: No change.
1: –A

Member.name: fmt_add_a
Member.description:
Processing mode when channel A is added (8 bits or 16 bits).
0: No change.
1: +A

Member.name: fmt_gray_rgb
Member.description:
Conversion from a gray picture to an RGB picture (8 bits or 16 bits).
0: No change.
1: Gray > BGR/AGray > ABGR

Member.name: fmt_124_8
Member.description:
Conversion from a 1-bit/2-bit/4-bit gray picture to an 8-bit gray picture.
0: No change.
1: 1-bit/2-bit/4-bit > 8-bit

Member.name: fmt_byte_rev
Member.description:
Arrangement of a 1-bit/2-bit/4-bit pixel in a byte.
0: No change.
1: Change the arrangement.

RegisterGroup.name: INT
RegisterGroup.description: INT is an interrupt query register.

Member.name: int_idat_crc_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that an IDAT CRC error occurs.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_adler_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that an Adler32 error occurs.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_zlib_cm_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the Z-lib streams are not compressed in deflate mode.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_zlib_cinfo_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the size of the Z-lib stream deflate window is greater than 32 KB.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_zlib_fdict_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the field of the Z-lib stream dictionary is 1.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_zlib_btype_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the block type of the Z-lib stream is 3.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_zlib_lenth_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that an error occurs when the length of the uncompressed Z-lib stream is checked.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_zlib_hlit_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the length of the dynamic Huffman literal table for decompressing the Z-lib stream is greater than 29.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_zlib_hdist_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the length of the dynamic Huffman distance table for decompressing the Z-lib stream is greater than 31.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_huff_dec_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that there is no corresponding Huffman code.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_dec_cpy_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the number of copy times is not 0 after the tables are decoded.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_flt_type_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the filtering type is greater than 4 during filtering.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_rdc_buf_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the end address is exceeded when the RDC module writes to a buffer.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_flt_buf_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the end address is exceeded when the FLT module writes to a buffer.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_fmt_buf_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the end address is exceeded when the FMT module writes to a buffer.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_dec_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that a decoding error occurs.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_bs_res
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the streams are used up.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

Member.name: int_dec_fnsh
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the current picture is decoded.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this field.

RegisterGroup.name: CHUNK_IDAT_CNT
RegisterGroup.description: CHUNK_IDAT_CNT is an error count register.

Member.name: chunk_idat_err_cnt
Member.description: Count of error IDAT chunks.

Member.name: chunk_idat_cnt
Member.description: Total count of IDAT chunks.

RegisterGroup.name: RST_BUSY
RegisterGroup.description: RST_BUSY is a soft reset readback register.

Member.name: rst_busy
Member.description:
Soft reset status.
0: reset
1: not reset

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_VER
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_VER is a TDE version register.

Member.name: version
Member.description: TDE version.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_RST
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_RST is a soft reset register. It is used to reset the TDE (excluding the registersaccessible to the CPU). After soft reset, the TDE is idle.

Member.name: reset
Member.description: Soft reset. After a reset takes effect, hardware sets this bit to 0 automatically.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_CTRL is a global control register. It is used to control the internal operations of the TDE.The CPU can read from or write to any of the four global control signals, but the operationdoes not always take effect.

Member.name: susp1
Member.description:
Suspend operation 1.
0: 0: Suspend operation 1 does not take effect.
1: An operation is suspended after the current node command is executed.
When the TDE is suspended, the TDE continues to perform internal operations after this bit is cleared by the software.

Member.name: susp2
Member.description:
Suspend operation 2.
0: Suspend operation 2 does not take effect.
1: Other tasks (excluding vertical scaling and anti-flicker) are suspended after the operation on the current line is performed.
When the TDE is suspended, the TDE continues to perform internal operations after this bit is cleared by the software.

Member.name: susp3
Member.description:
Suspend operation 3.
0: Suspend operation 3 does not take effect.
1: A suspended operation is performed after the latest node command is read.
When the TDE is suspended, the TDE continues to perform internal operations after this bit is cleared by the software.

Member.name: aqstart
Member.description:
TDE start enable in AQ mode.
0: enabled
1: After 1 is written to this bit, the TDE starts to work. Then, the hardware automatically sets this bit to 0.
When the TDE is idle and the AQ mode is enabled, an AQ operation is performed after this bit is set to 1.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_SQ_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_SQ_ADDR is a current node instruction pointer register of the SQ linked list. It showsthe current SQ node. When the SQ is working, this register stores the instruction pointer ofthe SQ node that is being used. When the SQ does not work, this register stores instructionpointer of the last SQ node that is processed by the previous SQ linked list.

Member.name: cur_sq_node_addr
Member.description: Start address for the current node of the SQ linked list.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_AQ_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_AQ_ADDR is a current node instruction pointer register of the AQ linked list. It showsthe current AQ node. When the AQ is working, this register stores the instruction pointer ofthe AQ node that is being used. When the AQ does not work, this register stores theinstruction pointer of the last AQ node that is processed by the previous AQ linked list.

Member.name: cur_aq_node_addr
Member.description: Start address for the current node of the AQ linked list.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_STA
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_STA is a working status register. It shows the internal working status of the TDE.

Member.name: line_num
Member.description:
Number of completed lines on the current node.
Note: This field is valid only when the TDE is suspended.

Member.name: link_empty
Member.description: Empty linked list indicator.

Member.name: aqsq_exec
Member.description:
Internal working mode of the TDE.
0: AQ mode
1: SQ mode

Member.name: dq_busy
Member.description: DMA queue busy indicator.

Member.name: busy
Member.description:
TDE busy indicator
0: idle
1: busy. That is, the TDE is working.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_INT
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_INT is an interrupt status register. It shows the internal interrupt status of the TDE. TheSQ and AQ linked list interrupts do not occur at the same time. The following is the priorityof the four interrupts of the SQ and AQ linked lists:link_compld > node_compld > line_susp > rdy2start

Member.name: error
Member.description:
TDE processing error interrupt, which results in the suspension of the TDE.
Note: The error interrupt is always valid, because it is not controlled by the interrupt mask register.

Member.name: aq_rdy2start
Member.description: Suspend interrupt that occurs after the AQ linked list reads the latest node command information.

Member.name: aq_line_susp
Member.description: Interrupt that occurs when the current line of the current node in the AQ linked list is suspended.

Member.name: aq_node_compld
Member.description: Interrupt that occurs when the operation on the current node in the AQ linked list is complete.

Member.name: aq_link_compld
Member.description: Interrupt that occurs when all the operations on the AQ linked list are complete.

Member.name: sq_update
Member.description: Interrupt that occurs when the SQ linked list requests for the update of the linked list header.

Member.name: sq_rdy2start
Member.description: Suspend interrupt that occurs after the SQ linked list reads the latest node command information.

Member.name: sq_line_susp
Member.description: Interrupt that occurs when the current line of the current node in the SQ linked list is suspended.

Member.name: sq_node_compld
Member.description: Interrupt that occurs when the operation on the current node in the SQ linked list is complete.

Member.name: sq_link_compld
Member.description: Interrupt that occurs when all the operations on the SQ linked list are complete.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_SQ_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_SQ_CTRL is an SQ linked list control register. It used to control the working status ofthe SQ linked lists. The registers for controlling SQ linked lists must be configured in thefollowing sequence: TDE_SQ_OFFSET, TDE_SQ_NADDR, TDE_SQ_UPDATE, andTDE_SQ_CTRL.

Member.name: sq_update_flag
Member.description:
SQ linked list header update flag.
0: The SQ linked list header can be updated.
1: The SQ linked list header cannot be updated.

Member.name: sq_en
Member.description:
SQ linked list enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
This bit is automatically cleared.

Member.name: sq_oper_mode
Member.description:
SQ linked list exception processing.
0x0: After the operation on the current SQ linked list is complete, the next SQ linked list is enabled.
0x4: After the operation on the current line of the current node in the current linked list is complete, the next SQ linked list is enabled.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: trig_cond
Member.description:
Trigger condition.
0: The top field is triggered in frame sync mode.
1: The bottom field is triggered in frame sync mode.

Member.name: trig_mode
Member.description:
Trigger mode.
0: frame sync
1: field sync

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_SQ_NADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_SQ_NADDR is an SQ linked list header pointer register.

Member.name: next_sq_node_addr
Member.description: Start address for the next node of the SQ linked list.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_SQ_UPDATE
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_SQ_UPDATE is an SQ linked list header instruction update parameter flag register.

Member.name: next_sq_update_ind
Member.description:
Indicator of updating the registers on the next node of the SQ linked list.
For example, if this register is set to 0010_0000_1011_0001_0000_0000_0100_1110, the registers corresponding to bits 1, 2, 3, 6, 16, 20, 21, 23, and 29 will be updated on the next node. For details about the mapping between bits and registers, see Table 7-1.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_SQ_OFFSET
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_SQ_OFFSET is an SQ trigger delay register.

Member.name: syn_offset
Member.description: Timing offset of the SQ linked list. The maximum value is 0x83D600.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_AQ_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_AQ_CTRL is an AQ linked list control register.

Member.name: aq_en
Member.description:
AQ linked list enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: aq_oper_mode
Member.description:
AQ linked list re-trigger mode.
0x0: After the operation on the current linked list is complete, the next AQ linked list is enabled.
0x4: After the operation on the current line of the current node in the current linked list is complete, the next AQ linked list is enabled.
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_AQ_NADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_AQ_NADDR is an AQ linked list header pointer register.

Member.name: next_aq_node_addr
Member.description: Start address for the next node of the AQ linked list.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_AQ_UPDATE
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_AQ_UPDATE is an AQ linked list header instruction update parameter flag register.

Member.name: next_aq_update_ind
Member.description:
Indicator of updating the registers on the next node of the AQ linked list.
For example, if this register is set to 0010_0000_1011_0001_0000_0000_0100_1110, the registers corresponding to bits 1, 2, 3, 6, 16, 20, 21, 23, and 29 will be updated on the next node. For details about the mapping between bits and registers, see Table 7-1.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_INS
RegisterGroup.description:
TDE_INS is an instruction control register. The macroblock processing mode depends on thevalue of mb_mode. The details are as follows:
  • When mb_mode is 3'b000, macroblock processing mode 0 is used. This mode is a high-quality luminance scaling mode. The luminance data is from source 1 channel.
  • When mb_mode is 3'b010, macroblock processing mode 1 is used. This mode is a high-quality chrominance scaling mode. The luminance data is from source 2 channel. Alphaprocessing is supported for the chrominance data and the data from source 1 channel.
  • When mb_mode is 3'b100, macroblock processing mode 2 is used. The luminance data isfrom source 1 channel. The chrominance data is from source 2 channel. After beingscaled, the chrominance data is combined with the luminance data.
  • When mb_mode is 3'b110, macroblock processing mode 3 is used. The luminance data isfrom source 1 channel, and the chrominance data is from source 2 channel. After beingcombined, the luminance data and chrominance data are scaled.
  • When mb_mode is 3'b001, macroblock processing mode 4 is used. The luminance data isfrom source 2 channel, and the background data is from source 1 channel. Alphaprocessing is supported for the luminance data and chrominance data.

Member.name: last_block_flag
Member.description:
Last block flag.
1: The block is the last one.
0: The block is not the last one.

Member.name: first_block_flag
Member.description:
First block flag.

Block flag.

Member.name: ocsc_conv
Member.description:
Output CSC enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: sq_irq_mask
Member.description:
0x00: Interrupts are masked.
0x01: The SQ linked list line suspend interrupt or line break interrupt is enabled.
0x02: A suspend interrupt is enabled. It indicates that when the latest node command information is read by the SQ linked list but no operation is performed on images.
0x04: The current node completion interrupt of the SQ linked list is enabled.
0x08: The SQ linked list completion interrupt is enabled.
0x10: The SQ linked list header update completion interrupt is enabled.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: aq_irq_mask
Member.description:
0x0: Interrupts are masked.
0x1: The AQ linked list line suspend interrupt or line break interrupt is enabled.
0x2: A suspend interrupt is enabled. It indicates that when the latest node command information is read by the AQ linked list but no operation is performed on images.
0x4: The current node completion interrupt of the AQ linked list is enabled.
0x8: The AQ linked list completion interrupt is enabled.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mb_en
Member.description: Macroblock operation enable.

Member.name: mb_mode
Member.description:
Macroblock processing mode.
000: high-quality luminance 2D filtering and scaling, VF/FF/HF
010: high-quality chrominance 2D filtering, scaling or up-sampling, VF/HF
100: Y/C combination after high-quality chrominance vertical/horizontal 2D up sampling
110: Y/C 2D filtering and scaling after Y/C combination (chrominance line copy, chrominance horizontal up sampling, or no chrominance processing)
001: luminance mixing
Other values: reserved

Member.name: src2_mod
Member.description:
Operating mode of source 2.
00: Source 2 is disabled.
01: The data of source 2 is from the image data in the memory.
10: The data of source 2 is from the pattern data in the memory.

Member.name: src1_mod
Member.description:
Operating mode of source 1.
000: Source 1 is disabled.
001: The data of source 1 is from the image data in the memory (excluding DMA).
011: The data of source 1 is from the color filling register (excluding fast filling).
101: Source 1 performs the DMA operation.
111: Source 1 performs the direct filling operation.
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_S1_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_S1_ADDR is a source 1 bitmap base address register.

Member.name: s1_base_addr
Member.description:
Base address for source 1 bitmap, that is, address when the bitmap coordinates are (0, 0).
For the date type of byte or sub byte, the base address must be on the byte boundary, and the pitch can be any multiple of the number of bytes.
For the data format of half-word, the base address must be on the half-word boundary, and the pitch must be a multiple of (2 x number of bytes).
For the data format of 24-bit, the base address must be on the word boundary, and the pitch must be a multiple of (4 x number of bytes).
For the data format of word, the base address must be on the word boundary, and the pitch must be a multiple of (4 x number of bytes).
For the data format of YCbCr422, the base address must be on the word boundary, and the pitch must be a multiple of (4 x number of bytes).

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_S1_TYPE
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_S1_TYPE is a source 1 bitmap type register.

Member.name: rgb_exp
Member.description:
RGB extension mode.
0: Lower bits are stuffed with 0s.
1: Data on upper bits is copied to the lower bits.

Member.name: v_scan_ord
Member.description:
Vertical scanning direction.
0: from top downwards
1: from bottom upwards

Member.name: h_scan_ord
Member.description:
Horizontal scanning direction.
0: from left rightwards
1: from right leftwards

Member.name: alpha_range
Member.description:
8-bit alpha range.
0: 0–128
1: 0–255

Member.name: s1_color_fmt
Member.description:
Pixel format of source 1.
0x00: RGB444
0x01: RGB555
0x02: RGB565
0x03: RGB888
0x04: ARGB4444
0x05: ARGB1555
0x06: ARGB8565
0x07: ARGB8888
0x08: CLUT1. The MSB maps to the rightmost pixel, which is similar to the little endian mode.
0x09: CLUT2. The MSB maps to the rightmost pixel, which is similar to the little endian mode.
0x0A: CLUT4. The MSB maps to the rightmost pixel, which is similar to the little endian mode.
0x0B: CLUT8
0x0C: ACLUT44
0x0D: ACLUT88
0x10: A1. The MSB maps to the rightmost pixel, which is similar to the little endian mode.
0x11: A8
0x12: YCbCr888
0x13: AYCbCr8888
0x14: YCbCr422. The X coordinate of the start pixel and the pixel width are even numbers.
0x16: byte
0x17: halfword
0x18: YCbCr400MB
0x19: YCbCr422MBH (1x2). The X coordinate of the start pixel and the pixel width are even numbers.
0x1A: YCbCr422MBV (2x1)
0x1B: YCbCr420MB. The X coordinate of the start pixel and the pixel width are even numbers.
0x1C: YCbCr444MB
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pitch
Member.description:
Line pitch of source 1 (only for lower 14 bits).
For the date type of byte or sub byte, the base address must be on the byte boundary, and the pitch can be any multiple of the number of bytes.
For the data format of half-word, the base address must be on the half-word boundary, and the pitch must be a multiple of (2 x number of bytes).
For the data format of 24-bit, the base address must be on the word boundary, and the pitch must be a multiple of (4 x number of bytes).
For the data format of word, the base address must be on the word boundary, and the pitch must be a multiple of (4 x number of bytes).
For the data format of YCbCr422, the base address must be on the word boundary, and the pitch must be a multiple of (4 x number of bytes).

Direct filling mode: A pixel is filled based on the image formats supported by source 1. The filled bits must be lower-bit aligned. For example, s1_color_fill bit[0] must be filled with 1 bpp pixel.
Color filling mode: The ARGB or AYCbCr 32-bit true color that is configured by the software is used.

Member.description: Start X coordinate of the target bitmap. The coordinate is related to the horizontal scanning direction.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_TS_SIZE
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_TS_SIZE is a target bitmap size register. If source 1 is used in non-macroblock mode,the size of source 1 bitmap is the same as that of the target bitmap. In macroblock mode, thebitmap size of source 1 is related to the TDE_S2_SIZE register. For details, see thedescription of TDE_S2_SIZE.

Member.name: alpha_threshold_hi
Member.description: If the output format is ARGB1555, alpha_threshold is the judgment threshold. alpha_threshold_hi indicates the upper four bits, and alpha_threshold_lo indicates the lower four bits. When the output alpha value is greater than or equal to alpha_threshold, the output 1-bit alpha value is 1; when the output alpha value is less than alpha_threshold, the output 1-bit alpha value is 0.

Member.name: s1_height
Member.description: Height of the output target bitmap or source 1 bitmap. The sizes of source 1 bitmap and the target bitmap are always the same.

Member.name: alpha_threshold_lo
Member.description: If the output format is ARGB1555, alpha_threshold is the judgment threshold. alpha_threshold_hi indicates the upper four bits, and alpha_threshold_lo indicates the lower four bits. When the output alpha value is greater than or equal to alpha_threshold, the output 1-bit alpha value is 1; when the output alpha value is less than alpha_threshold, the output 1-bit alpha value is 0.

Member.name: s1_width
Member.description: Width of the output target bitmap or source 1 bitmap. The sizes of source 1 bitmap and the target bitmap are always the same.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_COLOR_CONV
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_COLOR_CONV is a CLUT and CSC control register.

Member.name: alpha1
Member.description: In ARGB1555 mode, if the RGB extension mode rgb_exp is 1 and the alpha value is 1, alpha1 is used to extend the alpha bit to eight bits. The alpha value ranges from 0x00 to 0x80. The value 0x00 indicates fully transparent, and the value 0x80 indicates opaque.

Member.name: alpha0
Member.description: In ARGB1555 mode, if the RGB extended mode rgb_exp is 1 and the alpha value is 0, alpha0 is used to extend the alpha bit to eight bits. The alpha value ranges from 0x00 to 0x80. The value 0x00 indicates fully transparent, and the value 0x80 indicates opaque.

1: updated

Output color format.
0: unsigned number (0 to 255)
1: 2's complement (–128 to +127)

Member.name: out_color_space
Member.description:
Matrix for output CSC.
0: image matrix
1: video matrix

Member.name: out_colorimetry
Member.description:
Output CSC standard.
0: ITU-R BT.601
1: ITU-R BT.709

Member.name: in_chroma_fmt
Member.description:
Input color format.
0: unsigned number (0 to 255)
1: 2's complement (–128 to +127)

Member.name: in_color_space
Member.description:
Matrix for input CSC.
1: image matrix
0: video matrix

Member.name: in_rgb2yc
Member.description:
Input CSC direction.
0: from YC to RGB
1: from RGB to YC

Member.name: in_colorimetry
Member.description:
Input CSC standard.
0: ITU-R BT.601
1: ITU-R BT.709

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_CLUT_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_CLUT_ADDR is a CLUT memory address register.

Member.name: clut_addr
Member.description: Palette start address, word- aligned.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_2D_RSZ
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_2D_RSZ is a filtering and scaling control register.

Member.name: dfe_alpha_disable
Member.description:
Alpha anti-flicker enable.
0: enabled
1: disabled

Member.name: hf_coef_reload
Member.description:
Horizontal filtering coefficient update enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: vf_coef_reload
Member.description:
Vertical filtering coefficient update enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: coef_sym
Member.description:
Filtering coefficient attribute.
1: asymmetric
0: symmetric

Member.name: hf_ring_en
Member.description:
Median filtering enable when horizontal filtering is enabled.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: vf_ring_en
Member.description:
Median filtering enable when vertical filtering is enabled.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: alp_border_en
Member.description:
Alpha boundary processing enable.
00: disabled in both horizontal and vertical directions
01: enabled in the horizontal direction
10: enabled in the vertical direction
11: enabled in both horizontal and vertical directions

Member.name: dfe_mod
Member.description:
Anti-flicker mode.
00: fixed coefficient 0 mode
01: adaptive mode
10: test mode
11: reserved

Member.name: vf_mod
Member.description:
Vertical filtering mode.
00: no vertical filtering
01: vertical filtering only for the luminance chrominance channels
10: vertical filtering only for the alpha channel
11: vertical filtering for the alpha channel, and luminance and chrominance channels

Member.name: hf_mod
Member.description:
Horizontal filtering mode.
00: no horizontal filtering
01: horizontal filtering only for the luminance and chrominance channels
10: horizontal filtering only for the alpha channel
11: horizontal filtering for the alpha channel, and luminance and chrominance channels

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_HF_COEF_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_HF_COEF_ADDR is a memory address register for horizontal filtering coefficients.

Member.name: hf_coef_addr
Member.description: Start address of horizontal filtering coefficients.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_VF_COEF_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_VF_COEF_ADDR is a memory address register for vertical filtering coefficients.

Member.name: vf_coef_addr
Member.description: Start address for vertical filtering coefficients.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_RSZ_STEP
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_RSZ_HSTEP is a horizontal scaling step register. The horizontal scaling step iscalculated as follows: (Bitmap size of source 2 – 1)/(Size of the target bitmap – 1). Inmacroblock mode, the bitmap size may be the chrominance size or luminance size. For details,see the description of the TDE_S2_SIZE register.

Member.name: h_step
Member.description: Horizontal scaling step (8-bit integer, 12-bit decimal).

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_RSZ_Y_OFST
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_RSZ_Y_OFST is a vertical filtering phase offset register.

Member.name: v_ofst
Member.description:
offset of the vertical output initial pixel relative to the input initial pixel (1-bit sign bit, 4-bit integer, and 12-bit decimal).
Note:
v_ofst is 0 in non-macroblock mode.
v_ofst is in macroblock mode.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_RSZ_X_OFST
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_RSZ_X_OFST is a horizontal filtering phase offset register.

Member.name: h_ofst
Member.description:
offset of the horizontal output initial line relative to the input initial line (1-bit sign bit, 4-bit integer, and 12-bit decimal).
Note:
h_ofst is an integer within in non-macroblock mode.
h_ofst is in macroblock mode.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_DFE_COEF0
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_DFE_COEF0 is an anti-flicker coefficient 0 register.

Member.name: threshold0
Member.description: The coefficients of group 0 are used if the luminance difference among three adjacent lines is less than threshold0.

Member.name: coef0_cur_line
Member.description: Anti-flicker coefficient of group 0 for the current line (line K), unsigned number. This coefficient consists of 1-bit integer and 6-bit decimal, that is, <u, 1, 6>. The lower seven bits are valid.

Member.name: coef0_next_line
Member.description: Anti-flicker coefficient of group 0 for the previous line (line K – 1) or next line (line K + 1), unsigned number. This coefficient consists of 5-bit decimal, that is, <u, 0, 5>. The lower five bits are valid.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_DFE_COEF1
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_DFE_COEF1 is an anti-flicker coefficient 1 register.

Member.name: threshold1
Member.description: The coefficients of group 1 are used if the luminance difference among three adjacent lines is less than threshold1 but greater than or equal to threshold0.

Member.name: coef1_cur_line
Member.description: Anti-flicker coefficient of group 1 for the current line (line K), unsigned number. This coefficient consists of 1-bit integer and 6-bit decimal, that is, <u, 1, 6>. The lower seven bits are valid.

Member.name: coef1_next_line
Member.description: Anti-flicker coefficient of group 1 for the previous line (line K – 1) or next line (line K + 1), unsigned number. This coefficient consists of 5-bit decimal, that is, <u, 0, 5>. The lower five bits are valid.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_DFE_COEF2
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_DFE_COEF2 is an anti-flicker coefficient 2 register.

Member.name: threshold2
Member.description: The coefficients of group 2 are used if the luminance difference among three adjacent lines is less than threshold2 but greater than or equal to threshold1.

Member.name: coef2_cur_line
Member.description: Anti-flicker coefficient of group 2 for the current line (line K), unsigned number. This coefficient consists of 1-bit integer and 6-bit decimal, that is, <u, 1, 6>. The lower seven bits are valid.

Member.name: coef2_next_line
Member.description: Anti-flicker coefficient of group 2 for the previous line (line K – 1) or next line (line K + 1), unsigned number. This coefficient consists of 5-bit decimal, that is, <u, 0, 5>. The lower five bits are valid.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_DFE_COEF3
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_DFE_COEF3 is an anti-flicker coefficient 3 register.

Member.name: coef3_cur_line
Member.description: Anti-flicker coefficient of group 3 for the current line (line K), unsigned number. This coefficient consists of 1-bit integer and 6-bit decimal, that is, <u, 1, 6>. The lower seven bits are valid.

Member.name: coef3_next_line
Member.description: Anti-flicker coefficient of group 3 for the previous line (line K – 1) or next line (line K + 1), unsigned number. This coefficient consists of 5-bit decimal, that is, <u, 0, 5>. The lower five bits are valid.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_ALU
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_ALU is an ALU and colorkey control register.

Member.name: blend_reverse
Member.description:
Reverse enable for overlaying the foreground and background.
0: S1 is the background, and S2 is the foreground.
1: S2 is the background, and S1 is the foreground.

Member.name: ck_sel
Member.description:
Colorkey input select.
00: colorkey operation for source 1
01: reserved
10: colorkey operation on source 2 before CLUT
11: colorkey operation on source 2 after CLUT

Member.name: ck_alpha_mod
Member.description:
Operating mode of the alpha component in colorkey.
00: The alpha component must meet the following condition: Alphamin ≤ Alpha ≤ Alphamax.
01: The alpha component must meet the following condition: Alpha < Alphamin or Alpha > Alphamax.
10: The alpha component is ignored.
11: Reserved.

Member.name: ck_r_mod
Member.description:
Operating mode of the R component in colorkey.
00: The R component must meet the following condition: Rmin ≤ R ≤ Rmax.
01: The R component must meet the following condition: R < Rmin or R > Rmax.
10: The R component is ignored.
11: reserved

Member.name: ck_g_mod
Member.description:
Operating mode of the G component in colorkey.
00: The G component must meet the following condition: Gmin ≤ G ≤ Gmax.
01: The G component must meet the following condition: G < Gmin or G > Gmax.
10: The G component is ignored.
11: reserved

Member.name: ck_b_mod
Member.description:
Operating mode of the B component in colorkey.
00: The B component must meet the following condition: Bmin ≤ B ≤ Bmax.
01: The B component must meet the following condition: B < Bmin or B > Bmax.
10: The B component is ignored.
11: reserved

Member.name: global_alpha
Member.description:
Global alpha value. The default value is 0x80.
If a bitmap includes the pixel alpha, the global alpha value is multiplied by the pixel alpha to obtain the blended alpha value; if a bitmap does not include the pixel alpha, the global alpha value acts as the blended alpha value. The global alpha value ranges from 0x00 to 0x80. The value 0x00 indicates fully transparent.

Member.name: rgb_rop_mod
Member.description: ROP operating modes of RGB components.

Member.name: alpha_rop_mod
Member.description: ROP operating mode of the alpha component.

Member.name: alpha_threshold_en
Member.description:
Alpha threshold enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: alu_mod
Member.description:
ALU operating mode.
0x0: source 1 bypass
0x1: logical mode
0x2: blending mode
0x3: reserved
0x4: clip mask in logical mode, first pass
0x5: clip mask in blending mode
0x6: MB concatenation
0x7: source 2 bypass
0x8: clip mask in logical mode, second pass
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_CK_MIN
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_CK_MIN is a colorkey 1 register.

Member.name: alpha_min
Member.description: Minimum value of the alpha component for the colorkey comparison. The value ranges from 0x00 to 0x80. The value 0x00 indicates fully transparent, and the value 0x80 indicates opaque.

Member.name: red_min
Member.description: Minimum value of the R component for the colorkey comparison.

Member.name: green_min
Member.description: Minimum value of the G component for the colorkey comparison.

Member.name: blue_min
Member.description: Minimum value of the B component for the colorkey comparison. These bits are filled with the index values to be compared.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_CK_MAX
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_CK_MAX is a colorkey 2 register.

Member.name: alpha_max
Member.description: Maximum value of the alpha component for colorkey comparison. The value ranges from 0x00 to 0x80. The value 0x00 indicates fully transparent, and the value 0x80 indicates opaque.

Member.name: red_max
Member.description: Maximum value of the R component for the colorkey comparison.

Member.name: green_max
Member.description: Maximum value of the G component for the colorkey comparison.

Member.name: blue_max
Member.description: Maximum value of the B component for the colorkey comparison. These bits are filled with the index values to be compared

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_CLIP_START
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_CLIP_START is a clipping start position register.

Member.name: clip_mod
Member.description:
Clipping mode.
0: The area to be updated is within the specified rectangle (including the boundaries).
1: The area to be updated is outside the specified rectangle (excluding the boundaries).

Member.name: y_start
Member.description: Start Y coordinate of the clipping window.

Member.name: x_start
Member.description: Start X coordinate of the clipping window.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_CLIP_STOP
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_CLIP_STOP is a clipping end position register.

Member.name: y_stop
Member.description: End Y coordinate of the clipping window.

Member.name: x_stop
Member.description: End X coordinate of the clipping window.

Member.name: ch_sel2
Member.description:
Left and right channel control for I2S 2 output.
000: normal playing
001: two channels play left-channel audio files.
010: two channels play right-channel audio files.
011: The left channel plays audio files of the right channel, and the right channel plays audio files of the left channel.
100: The left and right channels play mixed audio files of the two channels.
101: The left channel is muted, and the right channel plays the audio files of the right channel.
110: The right channel is muted, and the left channel plays the audio files of the left channel.
111: The left and right channels are muted.

Member.name: spdif_ch_sel
Member.description:
Left and right channel control for SPDIF output.
000: normal playing
001: two channels play left-channel audio files.
010: two channels play right-channel audio files.
011: The left channel plays audio files of the right channel, and the right channel plays audio files of the left channel.
100: The left and right channels play mixed audio files of the two channels.
101: The left channel is muted, and the right channel plays the audio files of the right channel.
110: The right channel is muted, and the left channel plays the audio files of the left channel.
111: The left and right channels are muted.

Member.name: ch_sel1
Member.description:
Left and right channel control for I2S 1 output.
000: normal playing
001: two channels play left-channel audio files.
010: two channels play right-channel audio files.
011: The left channel plays audio files of the right channel, and the right channel plays audio files of the left channel.
100: The left and right channels play mixed audio files of the two channels.
101: The left channel is muted, and the right channel plays the audio files of the right channel.
110: The right channel is muted, and the left channel plays the audio files of the left channel.
111: The left and right channels are muted.

Member.name: ext1_ch_sel
Member.description:
MULTI_I2S1 output select.

01: I2S 1
10: I2S 2
11: MULTI_I2S1

Member.name: precision

I2S output data accuracy.

01: 18 bits
10: 20 bits
11: 24 bits

RegisterGroup.description: AO_MIXING_CTRL1 is mixing control register 1 (soft reset).

Member.name: al_ctrl
Member.description:
Input source mixing control for I2S 1 left channel.
Bit[29] indicates the exchange of the mixing coefficients. Bit[28] indicates the CPCM input. Bit[27] indicates the DPCM input. Bit[26] indicates the MPCM input. If the left channels of CPCM, DPCM, and MPCM inputs are C0, D0, and M0, the right channels of CPCM, DPCM, and MPCM inputs are C1, D1, and M1, and the mixing coefficients are A1 and A2, the mapping between I2S 1 left channel output and bit[28:24] is as follows when bit[29] is 0:
00101: OUT = 0 x A1 + M1 x A2
00110: OUT = M0 x A1 + 0 x A2
00111: OUT = M0 x A1 + M1 x A2
01001: OUT = 0 x A1 + D1 x A2
01010: OUT = D0 x A1 + 0 x A2
01011: OUT = D0 x A1 + D1 x A2
10001: OUT = 0 x A1 + C1 x A2
10010: OUT = C0 x A1 + 0 x A2
10011: OUT = C0 x A1 + C1 x A2
01100: OUT = D0 x A1 + M0 x A2
01101: OUT = D0 x A1 + M1 x A2
01110: OUT = D1 x A1 + M0 x A2
01111: OUT = D1 x A1 + M1 x A2
10100: OUT = C0 x A1 + M0 x A2
10101: OUT = C0 x A1 + M1 x A2
10110: OUT = C1 x A1 + M0 x A2
10111: OUT = C1 x A1 + M1 x A2
11000: OUT = C0 x A1 + D0 x A2
11001: OUT = C0 x A1 + D1 x A2
11010: OUT = C1 x A1 + D0 x A2
11011: OUT = C1 x A1 + D1 x A2
Other values: invalid configuration and OUT is 0.
Note: If bit[29] is 1, A1 and A2 are exchanged in the preceding formulas.

10011: OUT = C0 x A1 + C1 x A2

01111: OUT = D1 x A1 + M1 x A2
10100: OUT = C0 x A1 + M0 x A2
10101: OUT = C0 x A1 + M1 x A2
10110: OUT=C1 x A1 + M0 x A2
10111: OUT=C1 x A1 + M1 x A2

10111: OUT = C1 x A1 + M1 x A2
11000: OUT = C0 x A1 + D0 x A2
11001: OUT = C0 x A1 + D1 x A2
11010: OUT = C1 x A1 + D0 x A2
11011: OUT = C1 x A1 + D1 x A2
Other values: invalid configuration and OUT is 0.
Note: If bit[5] is 1, A1 and A2 are exchanged in the preceding formulas.

Member.description:
HDMI channel data round off configuration enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: hdmi_vid
Member.description:
The reverse requirements on the HDMI input interface timing can be met only when the reverse enable register is ORed with the INIF timing reverse register.
bit[22]:
0: vsync reverse is disabled.
1: vsync reverse is enabled.
bit[21]:
0: hsync reverse is disabled.
1: hsync reverse is enabled.
bit[20]:
0: dv reverse is disabled.
1: dv reverse is enabled.
bit[19]: reserved
bit[18:16]: The default value is 3b'100. HDMI video output format select. RGB or YCbCr can be selected by configuring the DHD channel.
000: YCbCr444, 30-bit sync embedded mode
001: YCbCr444, 30-bit sync separation mode
010: RGB444, 30-bit sync embedded mode
011: RGB444, 30-bit sync separation mode
100: YCbCr422, 20-bit sync embedded mode
101: YCbCr422, 20-bit sync separation mode
110: YCbCr422, 10-bit sync embedded mode
111: YCbCr422, 10-bit sync separation mode
Other values: reserved

Member.name: vga_order
Member.description:
Video graphics array (VGA) output sequence.
00: RGB
01: BGR
Other values: reserved

Member.name: dac3_sel
Member.description:
DAC3 output select. The default value is 01.
00: DAC3 outputs test data.
01: DAC3 outputs SD analog video (SDATE).
10: DAC3 outputs digital analog video.
11: DAC3 outputs HD analog video (HDATE).

Member.name: dac2_sel
Member.description:
DAC2 output select. The default value is 11.
00: DAC2 outputs test data.
01: DAC2 outputs SD analog video (SDATE).
10: DAC2 outputs digital analog video.
11: DAC2 outputs HD analog video (HDATE).

Member.name: dac1_sel
Member.description:
DAC1 output select. The default value is 11.
00: DAC1 outputs test data.
01: DAC1 outputs SD analog video (SDATE).
10: DAC1 outputs digital analog video.
11: DAC1 outputs HD analog video (HDATE).

Member.name: dac0_sel
Member.description:
DAC0 output select. The default value is 11.
00: DAC0 outputs test data.
01: DAC0 outputs SD analog video (SDATE)
10: DAC0 outputs digital analog video.
11: DAC0 outputs HD analog video (HDATE).

RegisterGroup.name: VOPARAUP
RegisterGroup.description: VOPARAUP is an update enable register for the registers related to filtering coefficients andLUTs. The VOU filtering coefficients are configured by the AXI master. The flags, whichindicate whether the start addresses and parameters need to be updated, are configured by theAPB slave.

Member.name: g2_lut_upd
Member.description:
Whether G2 LUT coefficients need to be updated. This bit is cleared automatically after the hardware updates the coefficients.
0: not updated
1: updated

Member.name: g1_vcoef_upd
Member.description:
Whether the G1 vertical filtering coefficients need to be updated. This bit is cleared automatically after the hardware updates the coefficients.
0: not updated
1: updated

Whether the G1 horizontal filtering coefficients need to be updated. This bit is cleared automatically after the hardware updates the coefficients.

1: updated

1: updated

0: not updated
1: updated

Member.description:
Whether G1 LUT coefficients need to be updated. This bit is cleared automatically after the hardware updates the coefficients.
0: not updated
1: updated

Member.name: g0_lut_upd
Member.description:
Whether G0 LUT coefficients need to be updated. This bit is cleared automatically after the hardware updates the coefficients.

1: updated

Member.name: vsd_vcoef_upd
Member.description:
Whether the VSD vertical filtering coefficients need to be updated. This bit is cleared automatically after the hardware updates the coefficients.
0: not updated
1: updated

Member.name: vsd_hcoef_upd
Member.description:
Whether the VSD horizontal filtering coefficients need to be updated. This bit is cleared automatically after the hardware updates the coefficients.
0: not updated
1: updated

Member.name: dhd_gamma_upd
Member.description:
Whether the LUT coefficients of the DHD gamma correction operation need to be updated. This bit is cleared automatically after the hardware updates the coefficients.
0: not updated
1: updated

Member.name: video_acc_upd
Member.description:
Whether the LUT coefficients of the ACC operation at the video layer need to be updated. This bit is cleared automatically after the hardware updates the coefficients.

Member.name: vhd_vcoef_upd

Layer enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: flip_en
Member.description:
Flip enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.description:
VHD mute enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: src_mode
Member.description:
Storage mode.
000: 2D
010: 1D
Other values: reserved

Member.name: ifir_mode
Member.description:
Horizontal chrominance IFIR mode.
00: Reserved.
01: chrominance IFIR copy mode
10: bilinear interpolation
11: 6-tap FIR

Member.name: vup_mode
Member.description:
VHD coefficient update mode.
0: update by frame
1: update by field

Member.name: bfield_first
Member.description:
Top field first. T indicates top field. B indicates bottom field.
0: top field first, T0B0T1B1 (T0B0 is regarded as a frame)
1: bottom field first, B0T0B1T0 (B0T0 is regarded as a frame)

Member.name: lm_rmode
Member.description:
Luminance read mode when de-interlace is disabled.
Luminance reference field mode when de-interlace is enabled.
00: reserved
01: Progressive read mode is invalid when de-interlace is enabled.
10: Only data at the top field is read. The top field is the reference field when de-interlace is enabled.
11: Only data at the bottom field is read. The bottom field is the reference field when de-interlace is enabled.

Member.name: chm_rmode
Member.description:
Chrominance read mode when de-interlace is disabled.
Chrominance reference field mode when de-interlace is enabled.
00: reserved
01: Progressive read mode is invalid when de-interlace is enabled.
10: Only data at the top field is read. The top field is the reference field when de-interlace is enabled.
11: Only data at the bottom field is read. The bottom field is the reference field when de-interlace is enabled.

Member.name: trid_en
Member.description:
3D enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: trid_mode
Member.description:
3D mode.
00: side by side
01: top and bottom
Other values: reserved

Member.name: time_out
Member.description: Timeout configuration.

Member.name: ifmt
Member.description:
Input data format.
0x1: SPYCbCr400
0x2: SPYCbCr411
0x3: SPYCbCr420
0x4: SPYCbCr422_1X2
0x5: SPYCbCr422_2X1
0x6: SPYCbCr444
0x9: PLNYCbCr400
0xA: PLNYCbCr411
0xB: PLNYCbCr420
0xC: PLNYCbCr422_1X2
0xD: PLNYCbCr422_2X1
0xE: PLNYCbCr444
0xF: PLNYCbCr410

RegisterGroup.name: VHDUPD
RegisterGroup.description: VHDUPD is a VHD update enable register.

Member.name: regup
Member.description: Layer register update. After the registers at this layer are configured, the registers are updated when the value 1 is written to this bit. After updates, this bit is cleared automatically by the hardware.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDLADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VHDLADDR is a previous frame address register. It is used for de-interlace. In package pixelformat, the address is the address for the frame buffer; in semi-planar pixel format, theaddress is the address for the luminance frame buffer.

Member.name: surface_laddr
Member.description: Address of the previous de-interlace frame.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDLCADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VHDLCADDR is a VHD previous chrominance (C/Cb) address register. It is used for de-interlace. In package pixel format, the address is invalid; in semi-planar pixel format, theaddress is the address for the chrominance frame buffer.

Member.name: surface_lcaddr
Member.description: Chrominance address for the previous de-interlace frame.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDLCRADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VHDLCRADDR is a VHD previous chrominance (Cr) address register. It is used for de-interlace. In package pixel format and in semi-planar pixel format, the address is invalid. Inplanar pixel format, the address is the address for the chrominance Cr frame buffer.

Member.name: surface_lcraddr
Member.description: Chrominance Cr address for the previous de-interlace frame.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDCADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VHDCADDR is a VHD current frame address register. In package pixel format, the address isthe address for the frame buffer; in semi-planar pixel format, the address is the address for theluminance frame buffer.

Member.name: surface_caddr
Member.description: Address of the current de-interlace frame.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDCCADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VHDCCADDR is a VHD current frame chrominance address register. In package pixelformat, the address is invalid; in semi-planar pixel format, the address is the address for thechrominance frame buffer.

Member.name: surface_ccaddr
Member.description: Chrominance address for the current de-interlace frame.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDCCRADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VHDCCRADDR is a VHD current frame chrominance address register. In package pixelformat and in semi-planar pixel format, the address is invalid; in planar pixel format, theaddress is the address for the chrominance Cr frame buffer. It is the address for the current de-interlace frame.

Member.name: surface_ccraddr
Member.description: Chrominance Cr address for the current de-interlace frame.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDNADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VHDNADDR is a VHD next frame address register. It is used for de-interlace. In packagepixel format, the address is the address for the frame buffer; in semi-planar pixel format, theaddress is the address for the luminance frame buffer.

Member.name: surface_naddr

RegisterGroup.name: VHDNCADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VHDNCADDR is a VHD next chrominance address register. It is used for de-interlace. Inpackage pixel format, the address is invalid; in semi-planar pixel format, the address is theaddress for the chrominance frame buffer.

Member.description: Chrominance address for the next de-interlace frame.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDNCRADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VHDNCRADDR is a VHD next chrominance address register. It is used for de-interlace. Inpackage pixel format and in semi-planar pixel format, the address is invalid. In planar pixelformat, the address is the address for the chrominance Cr frame buffer.

Member.name: surface_ncraddr

RegisterGroup.name: VHDVOFFSET
RegisterGroup.description: VHDVOFFSET is a VHD vertical scaling offset register. The vertical scaling offset is affectedby field offset during pan-scanning and field offset when repeated frames occur. If no fieldoffset occurs, vluma_offset is the lowest integral digit and the fractional part of offset_pan-scan. In YCbCr422 format, vchroma_offset is equal to vluma_offset; in YCbCr420 format,vchroma_offset is calculated as follows: vchroma_offset = hroma scaling ratio/2 – 0.25If fieldoffset is required (such as still frames or repeated frames) and the bottom field is repeated, thevalues of vluma_offset and vchroma_offset configured for the top field are the same as thosein the case of no field offset. The field offset must be considered when filtering coefficientsare configured for the bottom field.

Member.name: vluma_offset
Member.description: Vertical luminance offset, in (s, 4, 12) format. The value is expressed as a complement.

Member.name: vchroma_offset
Member.description: Vertical chrominance offset, in (s, 4, 12) format. The value is expressed as a complement.

RegisterGroup.name: VSDZMEORESO
RegisterGroup.description: VSDZMEORESO is a VSD scaler output resolution register. It is a non-instant register.

Member.name: oh
Member.description:
Height. The unit is line. The value is the actual height minus 1.
In progressive mode, the frame height is referenced; in interlaced mode, the field height is referenced.

Member.name: ow
Member.description:
Width. The unit is pixel. The value is the actual width minus 1.
Note: The actual width must be an even number.

Width. The unit is pixel. The value is the actual width minus 1.
Note: The actual width must be an even number.

RegisterGroup.name: G0SFPOS
RegisterGroup.description: G0SFPOS is a G0 start position register for data in the source read by the layer. It is a non-instant register. When the read position is not 128-bit-word aligned, this register indicates thenumber of required pixels supplemented for the 128-bit-word. Note: The offset of the startposition cannot exceed one 128-bit-word. The excessive part is expressed by address.The calculation is as follows:If the start address for the original image at the graphics layer is addr_ori, the address for thelogic graphics layer is addr_offset, the offset at the graphics layer is offsetp, and the dataformat at the graphics layer is bpp (for example the bpp of ARGB8888 is 32), the formula isas follows:G0ADDR = addr_offset = addr_ori + int (offsetp x bpp/128)G0SFPOS = offset%128int indicates that the value is rounded up to an integer. % indicates modular operation.

Member.name: src_xfpos
Member.description: Start X coordinate of the source. The value 0 indicates the first pixel of a line.

RegisterGroup.name: G0DFPOS
RegisterGroup.description: G0DFPOS is a G0 start position register for data in the display window transmitted by thelayer. It is a non-instant register. The unit is pixel.

Member.name: disp_yfpos
Member.description: Start vertical coordinate of the display window.

Member.name: disp_xfpos
Member.description: Start horizontal coordinate of the display window.

When the read position is not 128-bit-word aligned, this register indicates thenumber of required pixels supplemented for the 128-bit-word. The excessive part is expressed by address.The calculation is as follows:If the start address for the original image at the graphics layer is addr_ori, the address for thelogic graphics layer is addr_offset, the offset at the graphics layer is offsetp, and the dataformat at the graphics layer is bpp (for example the bpp of ARGB8888 is 32), the formula isas follows:G1ADDR = addr_offset = addr_ori + int (offsetp x bpp/128)G1SFPOS = offset%128int indicates that the value is rounded up to an integer. % indicates modular operation.

0x30: CLUT 8 bpp
0x38: ACLUT44
0x40: RGB444
0x41: RGB555
0x42: RGB565
0x43: PackageUYVY (Cb0Y0Cr0Y1)
0x44: PackageYUYV (Y0Cb0Y1Cr0)

0x60: KRGB888
0x68: ARGB8888
0x69: AYCbCr8888

0xe9: YCbCrA8888

RegisterGroup.name: ZONE1FPOS
RegisterGroup.description: ZONE1FPOS is a zone 1 start position register for data in the source read by the layer. It is anon-instant register. When the read position is not 128-bit-word aligned, this register indicatesthe number of required pixels supplemented for the 128-bit-word. Note: The offset of the startposition cannot exceed one 128-bit-word. The excessive part is expressed by address.The calculation is as follows:If the start address for the original image at the graphics layer is addr_ori, the address for thelogic graphics layer is addr_offset, the offset at the graphics layer is offsetp, and the dataformat at the graphics layer is bpp (for example the bpp of ARGB8888 is 32), the formula isas follows:G1ADDR = addr_offset = addr_ori + int (offsetp x bpp/128)G1SFPOS = offset%128int indicates that the value is rounded up to an integer. % indicates modular operation.

Member.description: Start X coordinate of zone 1 source. The value 0 indicates the first pixel of a line.

RegisterGroup.description: ZONE2FPOS is a zone 2 start position register for data in the source read by the layer. It is anon-instant register. When the read position is not 128-bit-word aligned, this register indicatesthe number of required pixels supplemented for the 128-bit-word. Note: The offset of the startposition cannot exceed one 128-bit-word. The excessive part is expressed by address.The calculation is as follows:If the start address for the original image at the graphics layer is addr_ori, the address for thelogic graphics layer is addr_offset, the offset at the graphics layer is offsetp, and the dataformat at the graphics layer is bpp (for example the bpp of ARGB8888 is 32), the formula isas follows:G1ADDR = addr_offset = addr_ori + int (offsetp x bpp/128)G1SFPOS = offset%128int indicates that the value is rounded up to an integer. % indicates modular operation.

Member.name: oh
Member.description:
Height. The unit is line. The value is the actual height minus 1.
Note: In interlaced output mode, the actual height must be an even number. There is no such a restriction in progressive output mode.

Member.name: ow
Member.description:
Width. The unit is pixel. The value is the actual width minus 1.
Note: The actual width must be an even number.

RegisterGroup.name: WBC3FCROP
RegisterGroup.description: WBC3FCROP is a WBC3 crop start coordinate register of the input image. It is a non-instantregister.

Member.name: hfcrop
Member.description:
Height. The unit is line. The value is the actual height minus 1.
Note: In interlaced output mode, the actual height must be an even number. There is no such a restriction in progressive output mode.

Member.name: wfcrop
Member.description:
Width. The unit is pixel. The value is the actual width minus 1.
Note: The actual width must be an even number.

RegisterGroup.name: WBC3LCROP
RegisterGroup.description: WBC3LCROP is a WBC3 crop end coordinate register of the input image. It is a non-instantregister.

Member.name: hlcrop
Member.description:
Height. The unit is line. The value is the actual height minus 1.
Note: In interlaced output mode, the actual height must be an even number. There is no such a restriction in progressive output mode.

Member.name: wlcrop
Member.description:
Width. The unit is pixel. The value is the actual width minus 1.
Note: The actual width must be an even number.

RegisterGroup.name: WBC3CMPADDR
RegisterGroup.description: WBC3CMPADDR is a WBC3 data write address register.

Member.name: wbc3_cmp_addr
Member.description: Frame buffer address. It is 4-byte-aligned and the lower two bits are invalid (seamless combination is supported).

RegisterGroup.name: CBMATTR
RegisterGroup.description: CBMATTR is a crossbar configuration register. sur_attr_x indicates that layer x connects tomixer 1 or mixer 2. mixer_prio_x indicates the layer configured in priority x. The priorities ofmixer 1 and mixer 2 are arranged together. The hardware remaps the priorities of mixer 1 andmixer 2 based on sur_attr_x and mixer_prio_x.It is a non-instant register.

Member.name: sur_attr0
Member.description:
G1 connection.
0: mixer 2
1: mixer 1

RegisterGroup.name: CBMMIX1
RegisterGroup.description: CBMMIX1 is a mixer 1 priority configuration register. It is a non-instant register.

Member.name: mixer_v_en
Member.description:
Video mixer enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: bk_v_alpha_sel
Member.description:
MIX_V background color alpha setting.
0: The alpha value is 0.
1: The alpha value is the VHD global alpha.

Member.name: mixer_prio4
Member.description:
Overlay layer priority configuration of mixer 1. It indicates the driver layer of priority 4.
000: no load
001: VHD
011: G0
100: G1
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mixer_prio3
Member.description:
Overlay layer priority configuration of mixer 1. It indicates the driver layer of priority 3.
000: no load
001: VHD
011: G0
100: G1
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mixer_prio2
Member.description:
Overlay layer priority configuration of mixer 1. It indicates the driver layer of priority 2.
000: no load
001: VHD
011: G0
100: G1
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mixer_prio1
Member.description:
Overlaid priority configuration of mixer 1. It indicates the driver layer of priority 1.
000: no load
001: VHD
011: G0
100: G1
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mixer_prio0
Member.description:
Overlay layer priority configuration of mixer 1. It indicates the driver layer of priority 0.
000: no load
001: VHD
011: G0
100: G1
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: CBMMIX2
RegisterGroup.description: CBMMIX2 is a mixer 2 priority configuration register. It is a non-instant register.

Member.name: mixer_prio2
Member.description:
Overlay layer priority configuration of mixer 2. It indicates the drive layer of priority 2 (the lowest priority).
000: no load
001: vdc_sd
010: gdc_g1
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mixer_prio1
Member.description:
Overlay layer priority configuration of mixer 1. It indicates the drive layer of priority 1 (the lowest priority).
000: no load
001: vdc_sd
010: gdc_g1

Member.description:
