RegisterGroup.name: DHDCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: DHDCTRL is a DHD global control register. It is an instant register. You must configure thisregister before configuring DHDCTRL[intf_en]. Otherwise, the configuration does not takeeffect.

Member.name: intf_en
Member.description:
Display interface enable (instant bit). Data is output over the interface only when this field is enabled.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: fpga_lmt_en
Member.description:
Debug bit. As the frequency of the FPGA clock bus is limited, the 1080i picture cannot be displayed. After this bit is enabled, the picture with 1280-pixel width can be displayed over the 1080i interface.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: fpga_lmt_width
Member.description: Debug field. When fpga_lmt_en is enabled, the active region width of the VDP interface depends on this field. The actual width of the active region is calculated as follows: Actual width of the active region = fpga_lmt_width x 16.

Member.name: clipen
Member.description:
Output clip enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: gmmen
Member.description:
Output gamma correction enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: gmmmode
Member.description:
Output gamma correction mode.
0: The gamma table is generated by the hardware.
1: The gamma table is configured by the software.

Member.name: idv
Member.description:
Output phase reverse enable for the data valid signal.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ihs
Member.description:
Output phase reverse enable for the horizontal sync pulse.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ivs
Member.description:
Output phase reverse enable for the vertical sync pulse.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: iop
Member.description:
Progressive or interlaced display.
0: interlace display
1: progressive display

Member.name: synm
Member.description:
Sync mode.
0: timing label mode (such as BT.656)
1: sync signal mode (such as LCD display)

Member.name: intfb
Member.description:
Bit width mode of the output interface.
00: single-component mode (Each clock outputs one component.)
01: 2-component mode (Each clock outputs two components.)
10: 3-component mode (Each clock outputs three components.)
11: Reserved.

Member.name: intfdm
Member.description:
Interface data format.
0x0: YCbCr422
0x1–0xB: reserved
0xC: RGB888/YCbCr444
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: DHDVSYNC
RegisterGroup.description: DHDVSYNC is a DHD vertical sync timing register. In interlaced output mode, this registerindicates the top field vertical sync timing; in progressive output mode, this register indicatesthe frame vertical sync timing. The setting of this register takes effect immediately afterconfiguration. That is, the timing of the VSYNC pin is affected immediately. You mustconfigure this register before configuring DHDCTRL[intf_en]. Otherwise, the configurationdoes not take effect.

Member.name: vfb
Member.description:
In interlaced output mode, it indicates the top field vertical blanking front porch.
In progressive output mode, it indicates the vertical blanking front porch.

Member.name: vbb
Member.description:
In interlaced output mode, it indicates the top field vertical blanking back porch.
In progressive output mode, it indicates the vertical blanking back porch plus the vertical pulse width.

Member.name: vact
Member.description:
In interlaced output mode, it indicates the height of an active image in a top field.
In progressive output mode, it indicates the height of an active image in a frame. The register value is the actual value minus 1.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDHSYNC1
RegisterGroup.description: DHDHSYNC1 is a DHD horizontal sync configuration register in interlaced or progressiveoutput mode. The setting of this register takes effect immediately after configuration. That is,the timing of the HSYNC pin is affected immediately. You must configure this register beforeconfiguring DHDCTRL[intf_en]. Otherwise, the configuration does not take effect.

Member.name: hbb
Member.description: Horizontal blanking back porch. The unit is pixel.

Member.name: hact
Member.description: Number of horizontal pixels in an active region.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDHSYNC2
RegisterGroup.description: DHDHSYNC2 is a DHD horizontal sync configuration register in interlaced or progressiveoutput mode. The setting of this register takes effect immediately after configuration. That is,the timing of the HSYNC pin is affected immediately. You must configure this register beforeconfiguring DHDCTRL[intf_en]. Otherwise, the configuration does not take effect.

Member.name: hmid
Member.description: Width of the bottom field vertical sync valid signal (in pixel).

Member.name: hfb
Member.description: Horizontal blanking front porch. The unit is pixel.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDVPLUS
RegisterGroup.description: DHDVPLUS is a DHD bottom field vertical sync timing register. In interlaced output mode,this register indicates the bottom field vertical sync timing. You must configure this registerbefore configuring DHDCTRL[intf_en]. Otherwise, the configuration does not take effect.

Member.name: bvfb
Member.description: In interlaced output mode, it indicates the bottom field vertical blanking front porch.

Member.name: bvbb
Member.description: In interlaced output mode, it indicates the bottom field vertical blanking back porch plus vertical pulse width.

Member.name: bvact
Member.description:
In interlaced output mode, it indicates the height of an active image in a bottom field.
The register value is the actual value minus 1.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDPWR
RegisterGroup.description: DHDPWR is a DHD sync signal pulse width register. You must configure this register beforeconfiguring DHDCTRL[intf_en]. Otherwise, the configuration does not take effect.

Member.name: vpw
Member.description: Vertical pulse width (VPW) minus 1.

Member.name: hpw
Member.description: Horizontal pulse width (HPW) minus 1.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDVTTHD3
RegisterGroup.description: DHDVTTHD3 is a DHD vertical timing threshold register. It is an instant register. It can beused to set two thresholds for generating two interrupts separately.

Member.name: thd4_mode
Member.description:
Threshold 4 interrupt generation mode.
0: frame mode. The threshold count is in the unit of frame.
1: field mode. The threshold count is in the unit of field in interlaced display mode.

Member.name: vtmgthd4
Member.description: Vertical timing threshold 4. It is used for DHD and DSD sync trigger. The time that DSD starts is later than that of DHD, and the time that DSD starts later than that of DHD equals to the number of the value of vtmgthd4.

Member.name: thd3_mode
Member.description:
Threshold 3 interrupt generation mode.
0: frame mode. The threshold count is in the unit of frame.
1: field mode. The threshold count is in the unit of field in interlaced display mode.

Member.name: vtmgthd3
Member.description: Vertical timing threshold 3. When the vertical timing counter reaches this threshold, the VOINTSTA[dhdvtthd3_int] interrupt is triggered.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDVTTHD
RegisterGroup.description: DHDVTTHD is a DHD vertical timing threshold register. It is an instant register. It can beused to set two thresholds for generating two interrupts separately.

Member.name: thd2_mode
Member.description:
Threshold 2 interrupt generation mode.
0: frame mode. The threshold count is in the unit of frame.
1: field mode. The threshold count is in the unit of field in interlaced display mode.

Member.name: vtmgthd2
Member.description: Vertical timing threshold 2. When the vertical timing counter reaches this threshold, the VOINTSTA[dhdvtthd2_int] interrupt is triggered.

Member.name: thd1_mode
Member.description:
Threshold 1 interrupt generation mode.
0: frame mode. The threshold count is in the unit of frame.
1: field mode. The threshold count is in the unit of field in interlaced display mode.

Member.name: vtmgthd1
Member.description: Vertical timing threshold 1. When the vertical timing counter reaches this threshold, the VOINTSTA[dhdvtthd_int1] interrupt is triggered.

RegisterGroup.name: HDATE_VERSION
RegisterGroup.description: HDATE_VERSION is an HD_DATE version register.

Member.name: hdate_version
Member.description: HD_DATE version, read-only.

RegisterGroup.name: HDATE_EN
RegisterGroup.description: HDATE_EN is an HD_DATE enable control register.

Member.name: hd_en
Member.description:
Module enable.
0: Except the registers with address space, all HD_DATE registers are disabled.
1: All HD_DATE registers are enabled.

RegisterGroup.name: HDATE_POLA_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: HDATE_POLA_CTRL is an HD_DATE input/output sync polarity configuration register.

Member.name: fid_out_pola
Member.description:
Output FID polarity control.
0: The top field flag output by HD_DATE is configured to the positive polarity. When the field flag is 1, it indicates the top field.
1: The top field flag output by HD_DATE is configured to the negative polarity. When the field flag is 0, it indicates the top field.

Member.name: vsync_out_pola
Member.description:
Output VSYNC polarity control.
0: The VSYNC signal output by HD_DATE is configured to the positive polarity. When the VSYNC signal is 1, it indicates sync header.
1: The VSYNC signal output by HD_DATE is configured to the negative polarity. When the VSYNC signal is 0, it indicates sync header.

Member.name: hsync_out_pola
Member.description:
Output HSYNC polarity control.
0: The HSYNC signal output by HD_DATE is configured to the positive polarity. When the HSYNC signal is 1, it indicates sync header.
1: The HSYNC signal output by HD_DATE indicates negative polarity. When the HSYNC signal is 0, it indicates sync header.

Member.name: fid_in_pola
Member.description:
Input FID polarity control.
0: The top field flag input by HD_DATE is configured to the positive polarity. When the field flag is 1, it indicates top field.
1: The top field flag input by HD_DATE is configured to the negative polarity. When the field flag is 0, it indicates top field.

Member.name: vsync_in_pola
Member.description:
Input VSYNC polarity control.
0: The VSYNC signal input by HD_DATE is configured to the positive polarity. When the VSYNC signal is 1, it indicates sync header.
1: The VSYNC signal input by HD_DATE is configured to the negative polarity. When the VSYNC signal is 0, it indicates sync header.

Member.name: hsync_in_pola
Member.description:
Input HSYNC polarity control.
0: The HSYNC signal input by HD_DATE is configured to the positive polarity. When the HSYNC signal is 1, it indicates sync header.
1: The HSYNC signal input by HD_DATE indicates negative polarity. When the HSYNC signal is 0, it indicates sync header.

RegisterGroup.name: HDATE_VIDEO_FORMAT
RegisterGroup.description: HDATE_VIDEO_FORMAT is an HD_DATE video format sync overlay and CSC controlregister.

Member.name: csc_ctrl
Member.description:
CSC control.
000: CSC from YCbCr to YPbPr
001: CSC from YCbCr to RGB complying with ITU-R BT709
010: CSC from YCbCr to RGB complying with ITU-R BT601
011: CSC from YCbCr to RGB complying with SMPTE240
Other values: user-defined

Member.name: video_out_ctrl
Member.description:
Output video format control.
000: RGB output (RGB embedded sync)
001: YPbPr output (YPbPr embedded sync)
010: VGA output (RGB+H+V)
011: reserved.

Member.name: sync_add_ctrl
Member.description:
Sync overlay control.
The three bits control three video components respectively.
1: overlay sync for the controlled channel
0: not overlaid
bit[6]: overlay sync control of R or Pr channel
bit[5]: overlay sync control of G or Y channel
bit[4]: overlay sync control of B or Pb channel

Member.name: video_ft
Member.description:
Sync format.
0000: 480p format, complying with SMPTE293M/EIA-770.2/ITU-R BT1358
0001: 576p format, complying with ITU-R BT1358
0010: 720p format, complying with EIA-770.3/SMPTE 296M
0011: 1080p format, complying with SMPTE 274M
0100: 1080i format, complying with EIA-770.3/SMPTE 274M
0101: 295m1080p format, complying with SMPTE 295M
0110: 295m1080i format, complying with SMPTE 295M
0111: as1152i format, complying with AS4933
1000: as1080i format, complying with AS4933
Other values: reserved for extending video formats

Member.name: frame_len

RegisterGroup.name: HDATE_OUT_CTRL

Member.name: sd_sel

Video input select for oversampling.

1: SD input

Member.name: sync_lpf_en
Member.description: Sync filtering enable.

Member.name: src_ctrl
Member.description:
Oversampling control.
00: no interpolation and no filtering
01: filtering. Only the coefficients of group 1 are used.
10: 2x interpolation
11: 4x interpolation

Member.name: video1_sel
Member.description:
Video1 output select.
0: No video is output.
01: R (Pr) output
10: G (Y) output
11: B (Pb) output

Member.name: video2_sel
Member.description:
Video2 output select.
0: No video is output.
01: R (Pr) output
10: G (Y) output
11: B (Pb) output

Member.name: video3_sel
Member.description:
Video3 output select.
0: No video is output.
01: R (Pr) output
10: G (Y) output
11: B (Pb) output

Member.name: hsync_sel
Member.description:
HSYNC output select.
0: no output
1: HSYNC output
2: VSYNC output
3: FID output

Member.name: vsync_sel
Member.description:
VSYNC output select.
0: no output
1: HSYNC output

Member.description:
Bandwidth select of the chrominance low-pass filter.
00: 1.1 MHz (NTSC)
01: 1.3 MHz (PAL)
10: 1.6 MHz (test)
11: reserved

Member.name: dis_ire
Member.description:
For the (M) NTSC and (M, N) PAL norms, the black level is 7.5 IRE higher than the blanking level; for other norms, the black level is equal to the blanking level.
This bit controls whether the black level is 7.5 IRE higher than the blanking level.
0: The black level is 7.5 IRE higher than the blanking level.
1: The black level is equal to the blanking level.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Reserved.
Writing to this field has no effect and reading this field returns 0.

Member.name: pal_half_en
Member.description:
PAL half-line reduction enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: pbpr_lpf_en
Member.description:
Chrominance low-pass filtering enable in component mode.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: scanline
Member.description:
Number of scanned lines in each frame based on standards. For the (M) NTSC, NTSC-J, and (M) PAL standards, each frame contains 525 lines; for the (B, D, J, H, I) PAL, (N) PAL, and (Nc) PAL standards, each frame contains 625 lines.
0: 525 lines in a frame
1: 625 lines in a frame

Member.name: rgb_en
Member.description:
Whether the component signal is RGB or YPbPr when intf_sel is set to 100.
0: YPbPr
1: RGB

Member.name: vbi_lpf_en
Member.description:
VBI data low-pass filtering enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: fm_sel
Member.description:
SECAM frequency modulation select.
0: sin used for SECAM frequency modulation
1: cos used for SECAM frequency modulation

Member.name: style_sel
Member.description:
CVBS/S-Video output signal standard when this bit works with the scanline bit.
When the scanline bit is 0 (525 scanned lines in a frame), the definition of the style_sel bit is as follows:
0001: (M) NTSC
0010: NTSC-J
0100: (M) PAL
When the scanline bit is 1 (625 scanned lines in a frame), the definition of the style_sel bit is as follows:
0001: (B, D, G, H, I) PAL
0010: (N) PAL
0100: (Nc) PAL
1000: SECAM
Other values: reserved

Member.name: sync_mode_sel
Member.description:
bit[17]: specifies whether there are sync signals in three channels during component output. This bit takes effect only when the sync_mode_scart bit is set to 0.
bit[17] is valid only when the intf_sel is set to 100 (component output enabled). The definition of bit[17] is as follows:
0: Only one channel contains sync signals during component output.
1: Three channels contain sync signals during component output.
When bit[17] is set to 0, the sync channel must be the Y channel for YPbPr output and G channel for RGB output.
bit[16]: specifies whether there are blanking radixes during RGB output. bit[16] is valid only when the intf_sel is set to 100 and the rgb_en bit is set to 1. The definition of bit[16] is as follows:
0: There is no blanking radix during RGB output.
1: There are blanking radixes during RGB output.

Member.name: sync_mode_scart
Member.description:
Overlay sync control of the components of three channels.
0: Component sync output is configured based on sync_mode_sel[1].
1: The components of the three channels are not overlaid and synchronized. In this case, sync_mode_sel bit[1] must be set to 0.

Member.name: length_sel
Member.description:
Active width of each video line (in pixel).
0: output according to the active line width in BT.601 mode
1: output according to the active line width in BT.470 mode
When this bit is set to 0, the active width of the line is 720 pixels. When this bit is set to 1, the active width of the line is 704 pixels for the 625-line standard or 712 pixels for the 525-line standard.
Currently, the BT.601 mode and BT.470 mode cannot be changed dynamically. You can change the mode only after reset. The BT.601 mode is recommended and this mode is the default value after power-on reset.

Member.name: agc_amp_sel
Member.description:
AGC pulse select.
0: The AGC pulse is generated based on the on-chip default value (recommended).
1: The AGC pulse is generated based on DATE_COEFF1[amp_outside].

Member.name: luma_dl
Member.description:
Forward or backward offset of the chrominance signal relative to the luminance signal (in half a pixel width).
bit[12]: offset direction of the chrominance signal relative to the luminance signal.
0: backward offset
1: forward offset
bit[11:9]: absolute offset of the chrominance signal relative to the luminance signal. The value is in binary format and ranges from 0 to 7.
000: The chrominance signal is aligned with the luminance signal. No adjustment is required.
001–111: The chrominance signal exceeds or lags behind the luminance signal by one to seven units.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Reserved.
Writing to this field has no effect and reading this field returns 0.

Member.name: oversam_en
Member.description:
Level-1 oversampling enable. Both the luminance oversampling and chrominance oversampling are controlled.
bit[7]: luminance oversampling enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
bit[6]: luminance oversampling enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: lunt_en
Member.description:
Luminance notch enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: oversam2_en
Member.description:
Level-2 oversampling enable. Both the luminance channel and chrominance channel are controlled.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: chlp_en
Member.description:
Chrominance low-pass filtering enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: sylp_en
Member.description:
Sync low-pass filtering enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: chgain_en
Member.description:
Chrominance gain enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.description:
Sequence of transmitting the bits of the teletext data.
0: from upper bits to lower bits
1: from lower bits to upper bits

RegisterGroup.name: DATE_COEFF10
RegisterGroup.description: DATE_COEFF10 is a DATE teletext configuration register.Currently, the teletext function is supported in both 625-line mode and 525-line mode. Thett_mode bit is set to 01 in 625-line mode and set to 10 in 525-line mode.

Member.name: tt_ready
Member.description:
When software sets related parameters through the bus, this bit is set to 1 and the teletext module starts to work.
When the teletext module completes data transfer, this bit is set to 0. The bit status can be queried through software for the next configuration.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Reserved.
Writing to this field has no effect and reading this field returns 0.

Member.name: nabts_100ire
Member.description:
NABTS-NTSC data height.
0: 70 IRE
1: 100 IRE

Member.name: full_page
Member.description:
Teletext data transmission mode.
0: normal mode. The teletext data is transferred in the blanking line.
1: full page mode. The teletext data can also be transferred in the active video area.

Member.name: tt_highest
Member.description:
Teletext priority control.
0: The teletext data has the highest priority.
1: The teletext data has the lowest priority.

Member.name: tt_mode
Member.description:
Teletext mode.
This field is set to 01 in 625-line mode, indicating WST-PAL.
This field is set to 10 in 525-line mode, indicating NABTS-NTSC.

Member.name: tt_pktoff
Member.description: Offset address for the teletext packet.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDHLCOEF
RegisterGroup.description: VHDHLCOEF is a VHD horizontal luminance filtering coefficient register.Each filtering coefficient consists of one signed bit and nine fractional bits. The MSB is thesigned bit and the lower nine bits are the absolute values of the fractional bits. As thecoefficients are stored in the on-chip memory, the default value is not defined.The VHD horizontal luminance filtering coefficients have eight taps and 32 phases. As thecoefficients are symmetrical, there are 17 groups of coefficients, that is, 8-tap coefficients ofphases 0–16 are stored. Each register address has two 10-bit coefficients. Therefore, four 32-bit register addresses are required for storing the 8-tap coefficients of each phase.

Member.name: hlcoefn2
Member.description:
Horizontal luminance filtering coefficient.
This field indicates the 2-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x0.
This field indicates the 4-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x4.
This field indicates the 6-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x8.
This field indicates the 8-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0xC.

Member.name: hlcoefn1
Member.description:
Horizontal luminance filtering coefficient.
This field indicates the 1-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x0.
This field indicates the 3-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x4.
This field indicates the 5-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x8.
This field indicates the 7-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0xC.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDHCCOEF
RegisterGroup.description: VHDHCCOEF is a VHD horizontal chrominance filtering coefficient register. For detailsabout the storage format, see the description of the VHDHLCOEF register. The VHDhorizontal chrominance filtering coefficients have four taps and 32 phases. As the coefficientsare symmetrical, there are 17 groups of coefficients. That is, 4-tap coefficients of phases 0–16are stored. Each register address has two 10-bit coefficients. Therefore, two 32-bit registeraddresses are required for storing the 4-tap coefficients of each phase.

Member.name: hccoefn2
Member.description:
Horizontal chrominance filtering coefficient.
This field indicates the 2-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x0 or 0x8.
This field indicates the 4-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x4 or 0xC.

Member.name: hccoefn1
Member.description:
Horizontal chrominance filtering coefficient.
This field indicates the 1-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x0 or 0x8.
This field indicates the 3-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x4 or 0xC.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDVLCOEF
RegisterGroup.description: VHDVLCOEF is a VHD vertical luminance filtering coefficient register. For details about thestorage format, see the description of the VHDHLCOEF register. The VHD verticalluminance filtering coefficients have six taps and 32 phases. As the coefficients aresymmetrical, there are 17 groups of coefficients. That is, 4-tap coefficients of phases 0–16 arestored. Each register address has two 10-bit coefficients. Therefore, four 32-bit registeraddresses are required for storing the 6-tap coefficients of each phase.

Member.name: vlcoefn2
Member.description:
Vertical luminance filtering coefficient.
This field indicates the 2-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x0.
This field indicates the 4-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x4.
This field indicates the 6-tap coefficients when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0x8.
This field is a reserved field when bit[3:0] of the register address are 0xC.

Member.name: vlcoefn1
Member.description:

RegisterGroup.name: VHDHLTICOEF
RegisterGroup.description: VHDHLTICOEF is a VHD horizontal LTI filtering coefficient register. Each filteringcoefficient consists of one signed bit and nine fractional bits. The MSB is the signed bit andthe lower nine bits are the absolute values of the fractional bits. As the coefficients are storedin the on-chip memory, the default value is not defined.The VHD horizontal luminance LTI coefficients have 2 taps and 32 phases. As thecoefficients are symmetrical, there are 17 groups of coefficients. That is, 8-tap coefficients ofphases 0–16 are stored. Each register address has two 10-bit coefficients. Therefore, four 32-bit register addresses are required for storing the 8-tap coefficients of each phase.

RegisterGroup.name: G0HLTICOEF
RegisterGroup.description: G0HLTICOEF is a G0 horizontal LTI filtering coefficient register.Each filtering coefficient consists of one signed bit and nine fractional bits. The MSB is thesigned bit and the lower nine bits are the absolute values of the fractional bits. As thecoefficients are stored in the on-chip memory, the default value is not defined.G0 horizontal LTI filtering coefficients have two taps and eight phases. Each register addresshas two 10-bit coefficients. Therefore, thirty-two 32-bit register addresses are required forstoring the 8-tap coefficients of each phase.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_DATA
RegisterGroup.description:
GPIO_DATA is a GPIO data register. It is used to buffer the input or output data.When the corresponding bit of GPIO_DIR is configured as output, the values written toGPIO_DATA are sent to the corresponding pin (note that the pin multiplexing configurationmust be correct). If the bit is configured as input, the value of the corresponding input pin isread.CAUTIONIf the corresponding bit of GPIO_DIR is configured as input, the pin value is returned after avalid read; if the corresponding bit is configured as output, the written value is returned after avalid read.GPIO_DATA masks the read and write operations on the register by using PADDR[9:2]. Theregister corresponds to 256 address spaces. PADDR[9:2] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0].When the corresponding bit is high, it can be read or written. Otherwise, no operations aresupported.
  • If the address is 0x3FC (0b11_1111_1100), the operations on GPIO_DATA[7:0] are valid.
  • If the address is 0x200 (0b10_0000_0000), only the operation on GPIO_DATA[7] isvalid.

Member.name: gpio_data
Member.description: GPIO input data when the GPIO is configured as input or GPIO output data when the GPIO is configured as output. Each bit can be controlled separately. The register is used together with GPIO_DIR.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_DIR
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_DIR is a GPIO direction control register. It is used to configure the direction of eachGPIO pin.

Member.name: gpio_dir
Member.description:
GPIO direction control. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively. Each bit can be controlled separately.
0: input
1: output

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IS
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_IS is a GPIO interrupt trigger register. It is used to configure the interrupt trigger mode.

Member.name: gpio_is
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt trigger control. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0]. Each bit can be controlled separately.
0: edge-sensitive mode
1: level-sensitive mode

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IBE
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_IBE is a GPIO interrupt edge control register. It is used to configure the edge triggermode of each GPIO pin.

Member.name: gpio_ibe
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt edge control. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively. Each bit can be controlled separately.
0: single-edge-sensitive mode. GPIO_IEV controls whether the interrupt is rising-edge-sensitive or falling-edge-sensitive.
1: dual-edge-sensitive mode

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IEV
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_IEV is a GPIO interrupt trigger event register. It is used to configure the interrupttrigger event of each GPIO pin.

Member.name: gpio_iev
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt trigger event. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0]. Each bit can be controlled separately.
0: falling-edge-sensitive mode or low-level-sensitive mode
1: rising-edge-sensitive mode or high-level-sensitive mode

Member.name: gpio_ie
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt mask. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0]. Each bit can be controlled separately.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.description:
GPIO raw interrupt status. Bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0], indicating the unmasked interrupt status. The status cannot be masked and controlled by GPIO_IE.
1: An interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_MIS

RegisterGroup.name: IR_EN

Member.name: ir_en
Member.description:
IR module enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: IR_CFG
RegisterGroup.description:
IR_CFG is an IR configuration register.CAUTIONBefore configuring this register, set IR_BUSY[ir_busy] to 0 and set Register DescriptionThe reference clock frequency supported by the IR module ranges from 1 MHz to 128 MHz.The mapping between the frequency and the clock frequency divider ir_freq is as follows:
  • If the reference clock frequency is 1 MHz, ir_freq must be set to 0x00.
  • If the reference clock frequency is 128 MHz, ir_freq must be set to 0x7F.When the IR reference clock frequency is not an integer ranging from 1 MHz to 128 MHz, theclock frequency divider is selected based on the rounded reference clock frequency. Forexample, if the reference clock frequency is 12.1 MHz, the clock frequency divider is 0x0B; ifthe reference clock frequency is 12.8 MHz, the clock frequency divider is 0x0C.The relationship between the frequency offset and count deviation is as follows:If the base frequency is f and the frequency variation is Df, the frequency offset ratio is Df/f. Ifthe count deviation of the counter is Dcnt, and the judge level width is s (in μs), the countdeviation Dcnt is 0.1 x s x ratio.Therefore, when the clock has frequency offset, the valid range of the parameter value needsto be changed. If the frequency increases, the corresponding margin range is changed to [min+ Dcnt, max + Dcnt]. Where, min and max indicate the margins without frequency offset. Ifthe frequency decreases, the offset range is changed to [min – Dcnt, max – Dcnt].Use the margin of the start bit in the lead code as an example. If the base frequency is 100MHz and the frequency increases by 0.1 MHz, the ratio is 0.001 (0.1/100). If s is 9000 μs,Dcnt is 1 (0.1 x 9000 x 0.001). In this case, the margin range of ir_leads must be changed to[0x033D, 0x3CD].

Member.name: ir_max_level_width
Member.description:
Invalid when IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 0.
Maximum level width (in 10μs) of a symbol when IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 1. This width indicates the end of a symbol stream.

Member.name: ir_format
Member.description:
Data code format when IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 0.
00: NEC with simple repeat code
01: TC9012 code
10: NEC with full repeat code
11: SONY code
For details about the mapping between code types and code formats, see Table 9-7 to Table 9-9.
Symbol format when IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 1.
bit[15]: reserved
The definitions of bit[14] are as follows:
0: The symbol is from low to high, and the symbol stream ends at the high level.
1: The symbol is from high to low, and the symbol stream ends at the low level.

Member.name: ir_bits
Member.description:
Number of data bits in a frame when IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 0.
0x00–0x2F: 1 to 48 data bits in a frame
0x30–0x3F: reserved
If ir_bits is set to a value ranging from 0x30 to 0x3F by using software, the setting has no effect and the original value is retained.
Symbol receive interrupt threshold when IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 1.
bit[13:8]: 0x0–0x3F. 0x0 indicates that an interrupt is reported when there is at least one symbol in the FIFO; 0x1F indicates that an interrupt is reported when there are at least 64 symbols in the FIFO.

Member.name: ir_mode
Member.description:
IR operating mode.
0: The decoded complete data frames are output.
1: Only the symbol width is output.

Member.name: ir_freq
Member.description:
Frequency divider of the working clock.
0x00–0x7F: Correspond to the working clock divider 1 to 128 respectively.

RegisterGroup.name: IR_LEADS
RegisterGroup.description:
IR_LEADS is a lead code start bit margin configuration register (valid only whenCAUTIONBefore configuring this register, set IR_BUSY[ir_busy] to 0 and set IR_EN[ir_en] to 1.Otherwise, the original value of the register is retained after configuration. The reserved bitsin the register cannot be configured.The margin must be considered based on the typical value of a specific code type foraccurately judging the start bit of the lead code. For details about the typical values forspecific code types, see the values of LEAD_S in Table 9-7 to Table 9-9.
  • For a pulse width whose typical value is greater than or equal to 400 (10 μs precision),the recommended margin is 8% of the typical value. For example, if the typical value ofLEAD_S for D6121 is 900, the value of cnt_leads_min is 0x33C (900 x 92% = 828 =0x33C) and the value of cnt_leads_max is 0x3CC (900 x 108% = 972 = 0x3CC).
  • For a pulse width whose typical value is less than 400 (10 μs precision), therecommended margin is 20% of the typical value. For example, if the typical value ofLEAD_S for SONY-D7C5 is 240, the value of cnt_leads_min is 0xC0 (240 x 80% = 192= 0xC0) and the value of cnt_leads_max is 0x120 (240 x 120% = 288 = 0x120).The basic configuration principles are: cnt_leads_max is greater than or equal tocnt_leads_min, and cnt_leads_min is greater than cnt0_b_max and cnt1_b_max.cnt_leads_min, and cnt_leads_min is greater than cnt0_b_max and cnt1_b_max.

Member.description:
Minimum pulse width of the start bit of the lead code.
0x000–0x007: reserved

Member.name: cnt_leads_max
Member.description:
Maximum pulse width of the start bit of the lead code.
0x000–0x007: reserved

Otherwise, when the actual count value is within the overlap range, bit 1cannot be identified and is regarded as bit 0 by mistake.The margin must be considered based on the typical value of a specific code type foraccurately judging bit 1. The margin is about 20% of the typical value.
  • For details about the typical values of the NEC with simple repeat code, NEC withsimple repeat code, and TC9012 code, see the values of B1_H in Table 9-7 to Table 9-9.For example, if the typical value of B1_H for D6121 is 169 (10 μs precision), the valueof cnt1_b_min is 0x87 (169 x 80% = 135 = 0x87) and the value of cnt1_b_max is 0xCB(169 x 120% = 203 = 0xCB).
  • For details about the typical value of the SONY code, see the values of B1_L in Table 9-7precision), the value of cnt1_b_min is 0x60 (120 x 80% = 96 = 0x60) and the value ofcnt1_b_max is 0x90 (120 x 120% = 144 = 0x90).
  • cnt1_b_max is 0x90 (120 x 120% = 144 = 0x90).The basic configuration principle is: cnt1_b_max is greater than or equal to cnt1_b_min.

Member.name: cnt1_b_min
Member.description:
Minimum pulse width of the level for judging bit 1.
0x000–0x007: reserved

Member.name: cnt1_b_max
Member.description:
Maximum pulse width of the level for judging bit 1.
0x000–0x007: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: IR_BUSY
RegisterGroup.description: IR_BUSY is a configuration busy flag register.

Member.name: ir_busy
Member.description:
Busy status flag.
0: idle. In this case, software can configure data.
1: busy. In this state, software cannot configure data.

RegisterGroup.name: IR_DATAH
RegisterGroup.description: IR_DATAH is an upper 16-bit IR receive decoded data register (IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 0) orsymbol FIFO symbol count register (IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 1).When IR_CFG[ir_mode] is set to 0, IR_DATAH stores the upper 16 bits of the decoded datareceived by the IR module, whereas IR_DATAL stores the lower 32 bits of the decoded datareceived. The data bits depend on the valid data bits in a frame of a specific code type. Fordetails, see the valid data bits in Table 9-7 to Table 9-9.Data is stored in IR_DATAL first and then IR_DATAH from MSB to LSB. After IR_DATALis full, the remaining data is stored in IR_DATAH. The unused upper bits are reserved. Data isread from IR_DATAH and then IR_DATAL.When IR_CFG[ir_mode] is set to 1, the hardware receives all data bits without checking thedefinition of each data bit. The software is responsible for processing data bits.

Member.name: ir_datah
Member.description:
Upper 16 bits of the decoded data received by the IR module when IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 0.
Number of symbols in the symbol FIFO when IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 1.
bit[15:7]: reserved
bit[6:0]: the number of symbols in the symbol FIFO

RegisterGroup.name: IR_DATAL
RegisterGroup.description: IR_DATAL is a lower 32-bit IR receive decoded data register (IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 0) or IRreceived symbol width register (IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 1).

Member.name: ir_datal
Member.description:
Lower 32 bits of the decoded data received by the IR module when IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 0.
Width of the symbol received by the IR module when IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 1.
The definitions of bit[31:16] are as follows:
Indicates the high-level width (in 10 μs) of the symbol received by the IR module when the level of the symbol is from low to high.
Indicates the low-level width (in 10 μs) of the symbol received by the IR module when the level of the symbol is from high to low.
The definitions of bit[15:0] are as follows:
Indicates the low-level width (in 10 μs) of the symbol received by the IR module when the level of the symbol is from low to high.
Indicates the high-level width (in 10 μs) of the symbol received by the IR module when the level of the symbol is from high to low.

RegisterGroup.name: IR_INT_MASK
RegisterGroup.description:
IR_INT_MASK is an IR interrupt mask register.CAUTION
  • Before configuring this register, set IR_EN[ir_en] to 1. Otherwise, the original value of theregister is retained after configuration.
  • If all interrupts are masked, the IR wakeup function is unavailable.
  • When IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 0, IR_INT_MASK bit[3:0] are valid; when IR_CFG[ir_mode]is 1, IR_INT_MASK bit[18:16] are valid.The definitions of the interrupts related to the register are as follows:
  • RX data overflow interrupt
    • If the CPU does not fetch the current frame and the next frame is already received, thenext frame overwrites the current frame and a raw RX data overflow error interrupt isreported.
  • RX data frame format error interrupt
    • If the received data frame is not complete or the data pulse width does not meet themargin requirements, a raw RX frame format error interrupt is reported.
  • RX data frame interrupt
    • After a complete frame data is received, a raw RX data frame interrupt is reported.
  • Key release detection interrupt
    • For the NEC with simple repeat code and TC9012 code, if the start synchronous code isnot detected again within 160 ms after the previously detected start synchronous code, ornot detected again within 160 ms after the previously detected start synchronous code, ora valid data frame rather than a simplified lead code is detected, a raw key releasedetection interrupt is reported. Both the NEC with full repeat code and the SONY codedo not support the key release detection interrupt.
  • RX symbol overflow interrupt
    • If the symbol FIFO is full because the CPU does not fetch the data in time and thesubsequent symbol is already received, a raw RX symbol overflow error interrupt isreported.
  • RX symbol interrupt
    • If a complete symbol is received and the number of symbols in the symbol FIFO isgreater than the threshold configured by IR_CFG[ir_bits], a raw RX symbol interrupt isreported.
  • Symbol timeout interrupt
    • If no new symbol interrupt is received during the period configured byinterrupt is reported.The hardware does not identify the interrupt priority. An interrupt is generated if one or moremasked interrupt sources are valid.

Member.description:
Symbol overflow interrupt mask when IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 1.
0: not masked
1: masked

Member.description:
Symbol timeout interrupt mask when IR_CFG[ir_mode] is 1.
0: not masked
1: masked

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_DATA
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_DATA is an SCI data register. It is used to transmit or receive characters and serves as thedata interface between the SCI and software.The software can write to the register only after SCI_CR1[mode] is set to 1. WhenSCI_CR1[mode] is set to 0, writing to this register has no effect.

Member.name: parity
Member.description:
Parity check error flag. This bit is transmitted with data during data transmission. During data reception, the software checks whether parity check is correct based on the value of this bit.
0: correct
1: incorrect

Member.name: scidata
Member.description: 8-bit read/write data.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CR0
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_CR0 is SCI control register 0. It is used to control clock enable, parity check, transferhandshake, and transfer bit definition.CAUTION
  • SCI_CR0[paritybit] controls whether the parity check function is enabled during datatransmission and reception. When this bit is set to 0, the structure of the received ortransmitted frame does not include the parity bit. According to T0 and T1 protocols, thisbit must be set to 1.
  • SCI_CR0[clkdis] and SCI_CR0[clkval] are used to enable the smart card clock andconfigure the clock pin state after the clock is disabled.
  • SCI_CR0[rxnak] and SCI_CR0[txnak] are used to enable the handshake mechanismbetween the SCI and smart card. Handshake indicates that the receiver pulls down the dataline (I/O) to request the transmitter to retransmit characters after detecting a parity checkerror in the data sent from the transmitter. The handshake mechanisms for datatransmission and reception are enabled separately. The maximum number of datatransmission or reception retry times is defined by SCI_RETRY. During ATR reception,character retransmission is not allowed; therefore, the handshake mechanism must bedisabled by setting the corresponding TX or RX control bit to 0.
  • SCI_CR0[rxparity] and SCI_CR0[txparity] are used to control the parity check mode indata reception and data transmission respectively.According to the direct convention, the low level of the data line (I/O) indicates logic 0 andthe LSB of data is after the start bit of a frame. If SCI_CR0 bit[1:0] are set to 0b00, the directconvention is selected.According to the inverse convention, the low level of the data line (I/O) indicates logic 1 andthe MSB of data is after the start bit of a frame. If SCI_CR0 bit[1:0] are set to 0b11, theinverse convention is selected.
NOTE
The character bit sequence and inversion of the data and parity bits can be configured separately. Thisfunction allows the SCI to support non-standard protocols (non-direct or non-inverse convention).Before the start TS character of the ATR is received, SCI_CR0 bit[1:0] must be set to 0b00. If the TScharacter indicates that the smart card complies with the inverse convention, SCI_CR0 bit[1:0] must beset to 0b11 before the next character of the ATR is received.

Member.name: detect_inv
Member.description:
Valid level selection of the detect input signal.
0: active high
1: active low

Member.name: vccen_inv
Member.description:
Valid level selection of the vccen output signal.
0: active high
1: active low

Member.name: paritybit

Parity bit transfer enable.

Smart card clock status when the clock stops.

1: The smart card clock is held high.

Member.description:
Clock start/stop control.

Member.name: txnak

1: yes

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CR2
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_CR2 is SCI control register 2. After a value is written to a specified bit of SCI_CR2, theSCI activates, releases, or soft-resets the smart card. When the SCI is releasing the smart card,writing to this register is ignored. In other cases, writing 1 to SCI_CR2[finish] enables theSCI to immediately send the card release timing.CAUTION
  • The software must write to CI_CR2 at appropriate card operation phases. An inappropriatewrite operation may result in an unexpected result.
  • The smart card can be soft-reset by the software only after the card is activated.

Member.name: wreset
Member.description:
Soft reset on the smart card.
0: invalid
1: soft reset
Note: This bit can be written only after the activation timing is transmitted.

Member.name: finish
Member.description:
Smart card release.
0: invalid
1: released
Note: This bit can be written only after the card reader detects a smart card.

Member.name: startup
Member.description:
Smart card activation.
0: invalid
1: activated
Note: This bit can be written only after the card reader detects a smart card.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CLKICC
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_CLKICC is a smart card clock frequency register. It defines the frequency divider of theexternal smart card clock. The smart card clock frequency is calculated as follows:FSCI_CLK = FREFCLK/2(clkicc + 1)In this formula, FSCI_CLK is the clock frequency, FREFCLK is the reference clock frequency, andclkicc is the value of SCI_CLKICC[clkicc].

Member.name: clkicc
Member.description: Frequency divider of the smart card clock (obtained by dividing the reference clock frequency). The value ranges from 0 to 255.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_VALUE
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_VALUE is an SCI_BAUD cycle count register in an ETU. The register is used tocalculate the ETU and can be set to a value ranging from 5 to 255. The ETU is calculated asfollows:ETU = (1 + baud) x value/FREFCLK.In this formula, FREFCLK is the reference clock frequency, baud is the value.

Member.name: value
Member.description: Number of SCI_BAUD cycles in an ETU.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BAUD
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_BAUD is a baud rate clock frequency divider register. It is used to calculate the ETU andcan be set to a value ranging from 0x1 to 0xFFFF. For details about how to calculate the ETU,see the SCI_VALUE description.

Member.name: baud
Member.description: Clock frequency divider of the baud rate.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_TIDE
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_TIDE is a TX or RX FIFO overflow threshold register.NOTE
Characters in the TX FIFO are removed only after being transmitted successfully.

Member.name: rxtide
Member.description:
Value for triggering the SCIRXTIDEINTR interrupt.
When the number of characters in the RX FIFO is greater than or equal to SCI_TIDE[rxtide], the RX FIFO overflow interrupt is triggered.

Member.name: txtide
Member.description:
Value for triggering the SCITXTIDEINTR interrupt.
When the number of characters in the TX FIFO is less than or equal to SCI_TIDE[txtide], the TX FIFO overflow interrupt is triggered.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_DMACR
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_DMACR is a DMA control register. It is used to control DMA data transmission andreception.

Member.name: txdmae
Member.description:
DMA enable for the TX FIFO.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: rxdmae
Member.description:
DMA enable of the RX FIFO.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_STABLE
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_STABLE is a smart card insertion stable time register. After the SCI detects that theSCI_DETECT signal is valid, the valid status must be retained for the period (seconds)specified by TSTABLE, which corresponds to the value defined by SCI_STABLE. After theperiod has elapsed, an interrupt is triggered, indicating that the smart card has been properlyinserted. The value of TSTABLE varies according to counter:
  • If "Use the whole internal bounce counter" is selected (that is, SCI_CR1[exdbnce] is setto 0), TSTABLE is calculated as follows:
    • TSTABLE = (1 + stable) x 65535 x TREFCLKTREFCLK is the SCI reference clock cycle (1/48 MHz), and stable is the value of
  • If "Bypass the non-programmable part of the internal debounce counter" is selected (thatis, SCI_CR1[exdbnce] is set to 1), TSTABLE is calculated as follows:
    • TSTABLE = stable x TREFCLK.

Member.name: stable
Member.description: Duration during which the card detection signal maintains stably high.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_ATIME
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_ATIME is a smart card activation time register. SCI_ATIME[atime] corresponds toSCIATIME shown in Figure 9-8 and indicates the durations of each of the three phasesinvolved in card reset and activation.NOTE
SCI_ATIME[atime] must be set to at least 40,000 smart card clock (SCI_CLK) cycles to ensure cardreset.SCI_ATIME[atime] must also ensure power stability for the smart card.

Member.name: atime
Member.description: Duration (SCI_CLK cycles) of each of the three phases involved the card activation timing. For details about the SCI timing for resetting a smart card, see Figure 9-8.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_DTIME
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_DTIME is a smart card release time register. SCI_DTIME[dtime] corresponds toSCIDTIME shown in Figure 9-8 and indicates the duration of each of the three phases in cardrelease.

Member.name: dtime
Member.description: Duration (SCI reference clock cycles) of each of the three phases involved in the card release timing. For details about the SCI timing for releasing a smart card, see Figure 9-9.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_ATRSTIME
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_ATRSTIME is an ATR reception wait time threshold register. SCI_ATRSTIME[dtime]corresponds to SCIATRSTIME shown in Figure 9-8. Based on the smart card clock, theregister defines the duration from finishing smart card reset to starting to receive the first ATRcharacter. If the first ATR character is not received within this duration, an interrupt istriggered and SCI_RIS[atrstoutim] is set to 1.NOTE
SCI_ATRSTIME[atrstime] must be set to 40,000 SCI_CLK cycles during software initialization.

Member.name: atrstime
Member.description: Time threshold (SCI_CLK cycles) for ATR reception timeout.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_ATRDTIME
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_ATRDTIME is an ATR reception time threshold register. If the duration from receivingthe first ATR character to receiving the last one exceeds the duration (in ETU) defined in thisregister, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[atrdtoutris] is set to 1.NOTE
Before using this register, set SCI_CR1[atrden] to 1 to enable the timeout count mechanism.According to the protocol, it is recommended that this register be set to 19,200 ETUs, namely 0x4B00.

Member.name: atrdtime
Member.description: ATR reception timeout threshold (in ETU) counting from the start bit of the first ATR character.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_STOPTIME
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_STOPTIME is a clock stop time register. When the smart card clock stop is enabled, thesmart card clock becomes invalid after the duration (SCI_CLK cycles) defined bySCI_STOPTIME has elapsed. Then an interrupt is triggered, and SCI_RIS[clkstpris] is set to1.NOTE
According to the protocol, the minimum clock stop duration is 1,860 SCI_CLK cycles, which meansthat SCI_STOPTIME[stoptime]must be set to 0x744.

Member.name: stoptime
Member.description: Duration (SCI_CLK cycles) for stopping the smart card clock.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_STARTTIME
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_STARTIME is a smart card clock recovery time register. If clock recovery is enabled,data can be transferred between the smart card and SCI after the duration (SCI_CLK cycles)defined in SCI_STARTTIME has elapsed. Then, an interrupt is triggered, andNOTE
According to the protocol, the minimum clock recovery duration is 700 SCI_CLK cycles, which meansthat SCI_STARTTIME[starttimr] must be set to 0x2BC.

Member.name: starttime
Member.description: Duration (SCI_CLK cycles) from starting the card clock to activating data transfer between the SCI and the smart card.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_RETRY
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_RETRY is a TX or RX retry times register. It defines the allowed number of TX or RXretry times. The details are as follows:
  • When SCI_CR0[txnak] is enabled, the SCI detects whether the receiver identifies acheck error. SCI_RETRY[rxretry] defines the maximum number of retry times after acheck error occurs. If the maximum number of retry times is exceeded, an interrupt istriggered and SCI_RIS[txerrris] is set to 1.
  • When SCI_CR0[rxnak] is enabled, the SCI detects whether a check error occurs in thereceived data. SCI_RETRY[txretry] defines the maximum number of retry times after acheck error occurs. If the value is exceeded but the error still persists, SCI_DATA[parity]is set to 1.

Member.name: rxretry
Member.description: Maximum number of RX retry times after a check error occurs.

Member.name: txretry
Member.description: Maximum number of TX retry times after a check error occurs.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CHTIMELS
RegisterGroup.description: CAUTIONSCI_CHTIME consists of the lower 16-bit SCI_CHTIMELS register and the upper 16-bitSCI_CHTIMEMS register. SCI_CHTIME does not take effect immediately when the softwarewrites to SCI_CHTIMEMS. SCI_CHTIME takes effect only when the software writes toSCI_CHTIME.SCI_CHTIMELS is a lower 16-bit register for the character reception interval timeoutthreshold.SCI_CHTIME defines the maximum interval (in ETU) between the starting edges of twoconsecutive characters received from the smart card. After the character reception interval haselapsed, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[chtoutris] is set to 1.

Member.name: chtimels
Member.description: Lower 16 bits for the character reception interval timeout threshold register SCICHTIME.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CHTIMEMS
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_CHTIMEMS is an upper 16-bit register for the character reception interval timeoutthreshold.

Member.name: chtimems
Member.description: Upper 16 bits for the character reception interval timeout threshold register SCICHTIME.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BLKTIMELS
RegisterGroup.description: CAUTIONSCI_BLKTIME consists of the lower 16-bit SCI_BLKTIMELS register and the upper 16-bitSCI_BLKTIMEMS register. SCI_BLKTIME does not take effect immediately when thesoftware writes to SCI_BLKTIMEMS. SCI_BLKTIME takes effect only when the softwarewrites to SCI_BLKTIMELS. Therefore, you must configure the upper 16 bits before thelower 16 bits for SCI_BLKTIME.SCI_BLKTIMELS is a lower 16-bit register for the block reception interval timeout threshold.SCI_BLKTIME defines the maximum block reception interval (in ETU) between the startingedge of the last character transmitted to the smart card and the first character received fromthe smart card. After the interval has elapsed, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[blkoutim]is set to 1.

Member.name: blktimels
Member.description: Lower 16 bits for the block reception interval timeout threshold register SCIBLKTIME.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BLKTIMEMS
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_BLKTIMES is an upper 16-bit register for the block reception interval timeout threshold.

Member.name: blktimems
Member.description: Upper 16 bits for the block reception interval timeout threshold register SCIBLKTIME.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CHGUARD
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_CHGUARD is a character guard interval register. It defines the minimum extra guardinterval (in ETU) between the starting edges of two consecutive characters when the SCI istransmitting characters to the smart card. The character guard interval depends on the globalinterface byte TC1 (obtained from the ATR timing) defined in the protocol.

Member.name: scichguard
Member.description: Character guard interval (in ETU).

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BLKGUARD
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_BLKGUARD is a block guard interval register. It defines the interval (in ETU) betweenthe starting edges of two consecutive characters with opposite transfer directions.

Member.name: sciblkguard
Member.description: Minimum interval (in ETU) between two consecutive characters with opposite transfer directions.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_RXTIME
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_RXTIME is an RX FIFO read timeout threshold register. When characters in the RXFIFO are not read out within the time defined by SCI_RXTIME, the RX read timeoutinterrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[rtoutris] is set to 1.CAUTIONIf the RX FIFO read timeout interrupt is enabled, SCI_RXTIME[rxtime] cannot be set to0x0000.

Member.name: rxtime
Member.description: RX read timeout interval (SCI_CLK cycles).

RegisterGroup.name: UART_DR
RegisterGroup.description: UART_DR is a UART data register that stores the received data and the data to be transmitted.The receive status can also be queried by reading this register.

Member.name: oe
Member.description:
Overflow error.
0: No overflow error occurs.
1: An overflow error occurs. A data segment is received when the RX FIFO is full.

Member.name: be
Member.description:
Break error.
0: No break error occurs.
1: A break error occurs. The receive data input signal keeps low longer than a full word transfer. A full word consists of a start bit, a data bit, a parity bit, and a stop bit.

Member.name: pe
Member.description:
Parity check error.
0: No parity check error occurs.
1: A parity check error occurs.

Member.name: fe
Member.description:
Frame error.
0: No frame error occurs.
1: A frame error (namely, stop bit error) occurs.

Member.name: data
Member.description: Data to be transmitted or received.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_RSR
RegisterGroup.description:
UART_RSR is a receive status register or error clear register.
  • It acts as the receive status register when being read.
  • It acts as the error clear register when being written.The receive status can also be read from UART_DR. The status information about the break,frame, and parity read from UART_DR has higher priority than that read from UART_RSR.In other words, the status information in UART_DR updates faster than that in UART_RSR.
NOTE
UART_RSR is reset when any value is written to it.

Member.name: oe
Member.description:
Overflow error.
0: No overflow error occurs.
1: An overflow error occurs.
When the FIFO is full, data cannot be written from the shift register to the FIFO and the content in the FIFO is valid. As a result, the shift register overflows. In this case, the CPU must read the data immediately to spare the FIFO.

Member.name: be
Member.description:
Break error.
0: No break error occurs.
1: A break error occurs.
A break error occurs when the receive data input signal keeps low longer than a full word transfer. A full word consists of a start bit, a data bit, a parity bit, and a stop bit.

Member.name: pe
Member.description:
Parity check error.
0: No parity check error occurs.
1: A parity check error occurs when the received data is checked.
In FIFO mode, the error is associated with the data at the top of the FIFO.

Member.name: fe
Member.description:
Frame error.
0: No frame error occurs.
1: The stop bit of the received data is incorrect. The valid stop bit is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_FR
RegisterGroup.description: UART_FR is a UART flag register.

Member.name: txfe
Member.description:
The definition of this bit is determined by the value of UART_LCR_H[FEN].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the TX holding register is empty.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, the bit is set to 1 when the TX FIFO is empty.

Member.name: rxff
Member.description:
The definition of this bit is determined by the value of UART_LCR_H[FEN].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the RX holding register is full.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the RX FIFO is full.

Member.name: txff
Member.description:
The definition of this bit is determined by the value of UART_LCR_H[FEN].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the TX holding register is full.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the TX FIFO is full.

Member.name: rxfe
Member.description:
The definition of this bit is determined by the value of UART_LCR_H[FEN].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the RX holding register is empty.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the RX FIFO is empty.

Member.name: busy
Member.description:
UART busy/idle status.
0: The UART is idle or data transmission is complete.
1: The UART is busy in transmitting data.
If this bit is set to 1, the status is kept until the entire byte (including all stop bits) is transmitted from the shift register.
Regardless of whether the UART is enabled, this bit is set to 1 when the TX FIFO is not empty.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IBRD
RegisterGroup.description: UART_IBRD is an integral baud rate register.

Member.name: bauddivint
Member.description: Clock frequency divider corresponding to the integral part of the baud rate. All bits are cleared after reset.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_FBRD
RegisterGroup.description:
UART_FBRD is a decimal baud rate register.CAUTION
  • The values of UART_IBRD and UART_FBRD can be updated until the current data istransmitted and received completely.
  • The minimum clock frequency divider is 1, and the maximum clock frequency divider is65,535 (216 – 1). In other words, UART_IBRD cannot be 0 and UART_FBRD is ignoredin this case. In addition, if UART_IBRD is 65,535 (0xFFFF), UART_FBRD must be 0. IfUART_FBRD is greater than 0, the transmit and receive operations fail.
  • If UART_FBRD is set to 0x1E and UART_IBRD is set to 0x01, the integral part of theclock frequency divider is 30 and the decimal part of the clock frequency divider is0.015625. The clock frequency divider is 30.015625.
  • UART baud rate = Internal bus frequency/(16 x clock frequency divider) = Internal busfrequency/(16 x 30.015625).

Member.name: banddivfrac
Member.description: Clock frequency divider corresponding to the decimal part of the baud rate. All bits are cleared after reset.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_LCR_H
RegisterGroup.description: UART_LCR_H is a transfer mode control register. The registers UART_LCR_H,UART_FBRD are updated, UART_LCR_H must be updated at the same time.

Member.name: sps
Member.description:
Parity check select.
When bit 1, bit 2, and bit 7 of this register are set to 1, the parity check bit is 0 during transmission and detection.
When bit 1 and bit 7 of this register are set to 1 and bit 2 of this register is set to 0, the parity check bit is 1 during transmission and detection.
When bit 1, bit 2, and bit 7 are cleared, the stick parity bit is disabled.

Member.name: wlen
Member.description:
Number of bits in a transmitted or received frame.
00: 5 bits
01: 6 bits
10: 7 bits
11: 8 bits

Member.name: fen
Member.description:
TX and RX FIFO enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: stp2
Member.description:
Check for the 2-bit stop bit at the end of a transmitted frame.
0: A 2-bit stop bit does not exist at the end of the transmitted frame.
1: A 2-bit stop bit exists at the end of the transmitted frame.
The receive logic does not check for the 2-bit stop bit during data reception.

Member.name: eps
Member.description:
Parity check select during data transmission and reception.
0: The odd parity bit is generated during data transmission and checked during data reception.
1: The even parity bit is generated during data transmission and checked during data reception.
When UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is invalid.

Member.name: pen
Member.description:
Parity check enable.
0: The parity check is disabled.
1: The parity check bit is generated on the transmit side and checked on the receive side.

Member.name: brk
Member.description:
Break transmit.
0: invalid
1: After the current data is transmitted, UTXD outputs low level continuously.
Note: This bit must retain 1 during the period of at least two full frames to ensure that the break command is executed properly. In normal cases, the bit must be set to 0.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_CR
RegisterGroup.description: UART_CR is a UART control register.To configure UART_CR, perform the following steps:Write 0 to UART_CR[uarten] to disable the UART.Wait until the current data transmission or reception is complete.Set UART_LCR_H[fen] to 0.Configure UART_CR.Write 1 to UART_CR[uarten] to enable the UART.----End

Member.name: ctsen
Member.description:
CTS hardware flow control enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled. Data is transmitted only when the nUARTCTS signal is valid.

Member.name: rtsen
Member.description:
RTS hardware flow control enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled. The data reception request is sent only when the RX FIFO has available space.

Member.name: rts
Member.description:
Request send.
This bit is the inversion of the status output signal nUARTRTS of the UART modem.
0: The output signal retains.
1: When this bit is set to 1, the output signal is 0.

Member.name: dtr
Member.description:
Data transmit ready.
This bit is the inversion of the status output signal nUARTDTR of the UART modem.
0: The output signal retains.
1: When this bit is set to 1, the output signal is 0.

Member.name: rxe
Member.description:
UART receive enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data reception, the current data reception is stopped abnormally.

Member.name: txe
Member.description:
UART transmit enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data transmission, the current data transmission is stopped abnormally.

Member.name: lbe
Member.description:
Loopback enable.
0: disabled
1: Signals are output over UARTTXD and input over UARTRXD.

Member.name: uarten
Member.description:
UART enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data reception and transmission, the data transfer is stopped abnormally.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IFLS
RegisterGroup.description: UART_IFLS is an FIFO interrupt threshold select register. It is used to set FIFO interrupt(UART_TXINTR or UART_RXINTR) trigger line.

Member.name: rxiflsel
Member.description:
RX FIFO interrupt threshold select. An RX FIFO interrupt is triggered when any of the following conditions is met:
000: The RX FIFO is 1/8 full.
001: The RX FIFO is 1/4 full.
010: The RX FIFO is 1/2 full.
011: The RX FIFO is 3/4 full.
100: The RX FIFO is 7/8 full.
101 to 111: reserved

Member.name: txiflsel
Member.description:
TX FIFO interrupt threshold select. A TX FIFO interrupt is triggered when any of the following conditions is met:
000: The TX FIFO is 7/8 empty.
001: The TX FIFO is 3/4 empty.
011: The TX FIFO is 1/4 empty.
010: The TX FIFO is 1/2 empty.
100: The TX FIFO is 1/8 empty.
101 to 111: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IMSC
RegisterGroup.description: UART_IMSC is an interrupt mask register. It is used to mask interrupts.

Member.name: oeim
Member.description:
Mask status of the overflow error interrupt.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: beim
Member.description:
Mask status of the break error interrupt.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: peim
Member.description:
Mask status of the parity check interrupt.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: feim
Member.description:
Mask status of the frame error interrupt.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: rtim
Member.description:
Mask status of the RX timeout interrupt.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: txim
Member.description:
Mask status of the TX interrupt.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: rxim
Member.description:
Mask status of the RX interrupt.
0: masked
1: not masked

RegisterGroup.name: INSNREG00
RegisterGroup.description: INSNREG00 is a micro-frame length configuration register.

Member.name: val
Member.description: Value of the micro-frame counter. This register is used only for emulation. In normal mode, the micro-frame length is 125 μs as defined in the protocol. During emulation, you can change the micro-frame length by configuring this register as required to reduce the emulation time.

Member.name: en
Member.description:
Micro-frame length configuration enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.description:
Automatic feature enable.
0 (default): enabled. The suspend signal is valid when the run/stop bit is reset by software, but the hchalted bit is not set.
1: disabled. The port is not suspended when software clears the run/stop bit.

Member.name: nak_reldfix_en
Member.description:
NAK reload enable.

1: disabled

1: enabled

Member.name: hcsparam_en

RegisterGroup.name: INSNREG06
RegisterGroup.description: INSNREG06 is an AHB error status register.

Member.name: err_capture
Member.description:
Whether an AHB error occurs.
0: no
1: yes

Member.name: hbusrt_err
Member.description: Hbrust value for control transfer when an AHB error occurs.

Member.name: num_beat_err
Member.description:
Number of beats during burst transfer when an AHB error occurs. The maximum number of beats is 16.
0x00–0x10: valid
0x11–0x1F: reserved

Member.name: num_beat_ok
Member.description: Number of completed beats during burst transfer when an AHB error occurs.
